title: can bus error
body:
### Describe the bug

This is a new unit. When installed i received a not registered error. the unit did highlight road edges and the proposed path in yellow. The dash cam error did remain on screen. I was sent a new branch i think it was and installed in the custom software selection. Immediately after the update I am getting a can bus connection error. It shows the road but no loger shows road edges edges or yellow path. The only thing i did was install the new software. I did install it in custom software selection instead of dash cam.

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

all today

### openpilot version

27395

### Additional info

I'm a noob to the process. my apologies.

title: UI watchdog reset when scrolling device after incompatible NVME installation/removal.
body:
### Describe the bug

Today I tried to install an nvme drive into my C3 but it caused many issues and later figured out that the nvme must be a specific type. Now after removing the ssd and resetting the device (it corrupted stuff) I am getting UI watchdog resets whenever I try to scroll on any menu. I tried to factory reset again, but now I am stuck on the terms and conditions agreement unable to scroll without the UI crashing. 

I am on a branch of master-ci that was working and is working for other people.

I will keep trying things

title: KIA EV6 - Check Parking Assist / Dashboard Sensors Preview Blinking
body:
### Describe the bug

Using latest 0.9.2 master-ci with commit 4eb48f55b4d14188ecd41c6fa124c56fe9164ad4 (taco2) changes fully disables all safety/parking assist features (sensors, 360 camera, blinker cameras, self parking, proximity braking, etc) making this unacceptable. 

Commenting out line {0x7B1, 1, 8}, in board/safety/safety_hyundai_canfd.h restores cameras and sensors, but dashboard preview of sensors is freaking out and self-parking fully broken. 

Here are videos of the bug:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23108129/231481760-3fc13183-adfd-4119-a743-069d8dd596d7.mp4
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23108129/231481766-07281782-04ee-450e-917b-f367132d5024.mp4

This is definitely something that needs to be addressed before full support rollout in the future :)

### Which car does this affect?

2022 KIA EV6 GT-LINE AWD (HDA2)

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

N/A

### openpilot version

0.9.2 master-ci with taco2 panda

### Additional info

_No response_

title: comma three: doesn't bootkick sometimes
body:
Seen once on our Corolla and in a support ticket. The fan was spinning in the Corolla, so it seems the panda thinks USB is enumerated which means it won't bootkick. Either:
* the SOM didn't fully shutdown or bootup
* usb enumeration false positive in the panda

title: Incorrect git dirty value
body:
### Describe the bug

system/version.py can incorrectly return true for is_dirty sometimes.

It appears the reason is that version.py's get_origin function can lookup the remote/origin for the wrong branch.

In this example get_origin finds branch name of HEAD using git name-rev, which returns a seemingly random branch name that is on the same commit as master.

```
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git log -1
commit 7acb4a94cc77a5d2b19b86fccdf373489bcb6f8d (HEAD -> master, comma/master, 00tsspsdsubutton)
Author: Harald Schäfer <harald.the.engineer@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 17 20:12:31 2023 -0800

    Update RELEASES.md
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git name-rev --name-only HEAD
00tsspsdsubutton
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'comma/master'.
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git remote -v
comma	https://github.com/commaai/openpilot (fetch)
comma	git@github.com:commaai/openpilot (push)
```

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

a152dad3c3368320|2023-02-18--16-36-32

### openpilot version

7acb4a94cc77a5d2b19b86fccdf373489bcb6f8d

### Additional info

_No response_

title: LKAS Faults - '17 Bolt
body:

### Background:

body:
### Describe the bug

System was working fine on part of my drive, but on another part, vehicle was drifting out of the lane onto the shoulder, and display was showing "green border" for being engaged/enabled. Failed to take control. During this time, I attempted to disable ACC and reenable/set. Kept on failing to move the steering. After disabled for a bit of time, I tried again, and it appeared to work.

Something was wrong where the Comma 3 Silently failed to control vehicle, and no warnings were given.

title: Restarting comma service kills ssh connection
body:
### Describe the bug

Using `tmux kill-session -t comma; rm -f /tmp/safe_staging_overlay.lock; tmux new -s comma -d "/data/openpilot/launch_openpilot.sh"; tmux a` would restart openpilot without issues.

The new suggested command seems to be `sudo systemctl restart comma` but this kicks off non-local ssh connections, specifically when using comma's `ssh.comma.ai` service.

1a5d045d2c531a6d

### openpilot version

0.9.1

_No response_

title: micd sometimes crashes on startup
GM camera cars crashing on first long engagement due to no long tune set if camera and no exp. mode toggle
body:
### Describe the bug

The long tune in gm/interface.py is only set for camera cars if experimental mode is enabled, otherwise it's left uninitialized, causing a controlsd crash on first long engagement due to long kp_bp being different length than kp_v (which is uninitialized). This PR fixes the problem: https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/26892

title: setup issue

labels.name: PC
labels.description: Issues related to running openpilot on PC

body:
### Describe the bug

Currently, you are trying to `source` the current SHELL `rc` in the [update_requirements.sh](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/e08896c45d84f4005de156317ae902d601e9b895/update_requirements.sh) script.

Example:
```bash
RC_FILE="${HOME}/.$(basename ${SHELL})rc"
# do some other stuff...
source $RC_FILE
```

a.k.a.
```bash
source ~/.bashrc
```

However, it is not possible to do this sort of action: [see explanation](https://askubuntu.com/questions/64387/cannot-successfully-source-bashrc-from-a-shell-script).



The current setup could *potentially* work for an working version of an openpilot dev environment. However, for greenfield users, running the setup for the first time, this results in an error:

``` bash
WARNING: seems you still have not added 'pyenv' to the load path.

# Load pyenv automatically by appending
# the following to
~/.bash_profile if it exists, otherwise ~/.profile (for login shells)
and ~/.bashrc (for interactive shells) :

export PYENV_ROOT="$HOME/.pyenv"
command -v pyenv >/dev/null || export PATH="$PYENV_ROOT/bin:$PATH"
eval "$(pyenv init -)"

# Restart your shell for the changes to take effect.

# Load pyenv-virtualenv automatically by adding
# the following to ~/.bashrc:

eval "$(pyenv virtualenv-init -)"

pyenv update ...
/home/jeroen/openpilot/update_requirements.sh: line 35: pyenv: command not found
```



### OS Version

Ubuntu 20.04

### openpilot version or commit

_No response_

### Additional info

_No response_

title: Eon Gold Devkit "Getting Started" Loop
body:
### Describe the bug

Backstory:
I have a comma eon Gold devkit, and have had it for several years now (bought new in 2019, I think). I've had it in my 2018 Honda Accord. It hasn't been updated in probably a year or two. A couple weeks ago, I purchased a 2022 Honda Civic Si, so the eon finally came in the house and I decided to update it and see what I needed to do to get it into the new civic. Started by tearing apart the rear view mirror area of the car to get a look at the lkas system. Looks like it's the same connector as my 18 accord (not sure if this helps anyone), but I couldn't get the panda plugged in to the lkas while it was mounted without altering the headliner of the car (the lkas is too close to the headliner and the panda is too large to fit). So, I came inside and decided to start updating the device while I look online to see if anyone has a solution to this problem yet. 

The Issue:
Updated the device, and now it's stuck on the "getting started" screen (see attached image). When I click the "Continue to Setup" button, it takes me to the page where I can select to use as dashcam, or download software. If I click to download software, I can input the URL ( I used openpilot.comma.ai per the instructions from virtuallyChris), then it loads for about 3 seconds, restarts the device and takes me back to the "Getting started" page. I also tried the "use as dashcam" option, and after selecting that, it does the exact same thing... Right back to the "Getting Started" page. 

Any help with getting the eon up and running again is greatly appreciated. Also, any help getting this installed in the new civic is extremely appreciated!

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

N/A

### openpilot version

0

### Additional info

Cannot provide a route or openpilot version as it is stuck in the "Getting Started" loop.

title: Change Branch UI Not Working
body:
### Describe the bug

Changing branches using the UI menu, after a fresh pull of a branch, causes an incomplete build. Upon pressing "Install" after "Download" of the branch causes the Comma3 device to get stuck on the Logo upon reboot.

Relevant info when SSH'ing onto the device while stuck on boot logo.

```
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git status
On branch h90d-3-frames
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/h90d-3-frames'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
  (commit or discard the untracked or modified content in submodules)
	modified:   body (modified content, untracked content)
	modified:   cereal (modified content, untracked content)
	modified:   opendbc (modified content, untracked content)
	modified:   panda (modified content, untracked content)
	modified:   tinygrad_repo (modified content)

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ git branch -v
* h90d-3-frames dc01ebe75 3 frames
  master-ci     8faa84833 openpilot v0.8.17 release
```

TMUX session information

```
Waiting for wayland
wayland ready
adjusting time from '2022-08-31 08:27:50.024705' to '2022-11-01 21:58:49'
Tue 01 Nov 2022 09:58:49 PM UTC
INFO:root:System time valid
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./build.py", line 8, in <module>
    from common.basedir import BASEDIR
  File "/data/openpilot/common/basedir.py", line 4, in <module>
    from system.hardware import PC
  File "/data/openpilot/system/hardware/__init__.py", line 4, in <module>
    from system.hardware.base import HardwareBase
  File "/data/openpilot/system/hardware/base.py", line 5, in <module>
    from cereal import log
ImportError: cannot import name 'log' from 'cereal' (unknown location)
```

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

eb5a50f9e98f50b9

### openpilot version

0.8.17-master-ci

### Additional info

Steps taken to produce bug:

1. Fresh clone of OP using a specific branch

`git clone https://github.com/commaai/openpilot.git --branch h90d-3-frames --recurse-submodules`

2. Built OP manually and rebooted device
3. Drove with OP to test
4. Change to `master-ci` using UI menu
5. Download & Install (using buttons on UI)
6. Drive with OP to test
7. Change back to original branch `h90d-3-frames` using UI menu
8. Download & Install (using buttons on UI)
9. Stuck on boot logo

Bootlog (`.bz2`) can be provided if needed. `bootlogs/eb5a50f9e98f50b9/2022-11-01--12-17-02.bz2`

title: Some bugs in use[version:dragonpilot v2022.09.07,git branch:DP817C2,git commit:e091c9161e]
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello, thank you very much for your efforts to let me experience the fun of automatic driving. I bought a set of your equipment and connected it to my car. Everything works normally. I went to the road to measure it and found some problems:

1. You can't turn automatically at a turn with a large bending angle, but stop driving.

2. When the car is in the left lane, turn on the turn signal, and the car will automatically turn left. In fact, it can no longer turn left at this time. If you continue to turn left, you will hit the wall.

3. It is impossible to identify pedestrians in front during driving. When there are pedestrians in front, the car will not slow down or stop automatically.

4. When passing other cars during the driving process, I was about 1m away from other cars in the transverse direction at the beginning, and he would automatically approach other cars to make the transverse distance approach about 15cm. Is this caused by my wrong use?

In view of the above issues, I would like to ask whether there is an upgraded version that can better optimize these issues, and whether a version with more accurate recognition and better use experience will be available to users in the future. If there is a new version in the future, when will it be?

### Which car does this affect?

Toyota Leiling

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

？？

### openpilot version

[version:dragonpilot v2022.09.07,git branch:DP817C2,git commit:e091c9161e]

### Additional info

_No response_

title: 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 HDA 2 OP won't control steering
body:
### Describe the bug

I've been working via discord with Sunnyhaibin and a few others on this issue. I added the camera firmware info to my vaules.py and the car is now recognized but steering is not controlled when I engage OP in my 2023 Ioniq 5 with HDA 2. 

I'm using Master-ci branch. I've swapped the USB C cable from the power harness (harness box 1)to the Comma 3, the USB A to A cable from the other harness box (harness box 2, with connection only to camera and red panda)to the Red panda, the OTG adapter connecting the USB A to the Comma, swapped wires on the Hyundai Q to match Hyundai K, pulled Hyundai K harness from my Elantra and swapped wires to match Hyundai Q. I've tried Sunnypilot branch as well. When engaging OP with OP Long enabled I get a harness relay error.

@adeebshihadeh said he would check this out today. 

@sunnyhaibin created PR #26145 to have the firmware version added for my car

### Which car does this affect?

title: GM camera ACC: LKAS faults
body:
- [x] Fault when relay opens (we send counter of 1, should copy camera's counter) - https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/26039
- [x] Fault when relay opens with above fix - We can be sort of unlucky and try to send a message just before the relay opens, blocking it, then reading an updated counter from the camera (that doesn't reach the car), and end up skipping a counter. It's rare, but still a possibility. - https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/27163
- [x] Random LKAS faults -> perm faults - https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/27250
- [x] Fault when relay closes (our counter doesn't sync up with camera's) - https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/27164

title: Hyundai: some cars do not set ego set speed
body:
These cars do not set `CF_Clu_VehicleSpeed2`. Printing `(ret.vEgoRaw, cp.vl["CLU15"]["CF_Clu_VehicleSpeed2"], cp.vl["CLU15"]["CF_Clu_VehicleSpeed"] * speed_conv)`:

```python
================================================================================================== short test summary info ==================================================================================================
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_73_HYUNDAI_SONATA_2019::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (14.437933921813965, 0.0, 24.14016)
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_63_HYUNDAI_IONIQ_PLUG_IN_HYBRID_2019::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (5.679253578186035, 0.0, 8.940800000000001)
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_59_HYUNDAI_IONIQ_ELECTRIC_LIMITED_2019::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (3.046875, 0.0, 4.470400000000001)
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_89_KIA_OPTIMA_SX_2019_2016::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (14.24696159362793, 0.0, 14.166666666666668)
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_86_KIA_NIRO_HYBRID_2019::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (14.555121421813965, 0.0, 23.246080000000003)
FAILED test_models.py::TestCarModel_91_KIA_SORENTO_GT_LINE_2018::test_panda_safety_carstate - AssertionError: (9.37717056274414, 0.0, 10.0)
```

These cars do set `CF_Clu_VehicleSpeed`, and it matches pretty well on our Optima, however on certain cars this signal can be super noisy (oscillating by a whole kph). What does the dash do? Sample this signal at a lower rate? We can't add hysteresis to a signal that already has it applied, or it will not match in most cases.

Another issue is that `CF_Clu_VehicleSpeed` is always in metric, never the unit of the dash, so there might be rounding errors (it can mismatch the dash by 1 mph in rare scenarios). What does the dash do here too?

title: Hyundai:  HDA-1 CAN-FD resume from ACC standstill
body:
### Describe the bug

Resume from standstill via button spamming does not work for hkg HDA-1 CAN-FD cars. My case is with an HDA 1 EV6 although I have been told this is the case with all HDA1 CAN-FD cars.
 
This is a known bug where CAN-FD hkg cars with HDA1 can send button presses, but the car does not respond to them. The HDA1 EV6 uses the 0x1cf cruise button signal on Panda bus 0 (send_can bus 4). The route provided at the 100s mark shows the car not resuming on Master (aea1a0d5e684daf7682703174233390b0cf79c83) with the following required fixes for hda1 EV6 (https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/25723). 

Other HDA1 CAN-FD cars such as the Tucson use an alt_cruise_button signal for button presses but my understanding is that there is no response from the car in that case either.

Attempted solutions:
1. I have tried changing the code in hyundaicanfd.py to allow for the 0x1cf Cruise_buttons signal to be sent on bus 4 (as required for the HDA1 EV6) rather than bus 5 (as required for the HDA2 EV6), but this did not help. After this change, I can see button presses are being sent to the car by looking at send_can bus 4 in plotjuggler, but there is no response from the car.



### Provide a route where the issue occurs

68d6a96e703c00c9|2022-09-10--16-25-04--0

### openpilot version

https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/25723

### Additional info

Is it possible to make a can message for an accelerator press at an extremely minor level (not even enough to move a car), but just enough to activate the resume from standstill?

title: An out-of-range value is assigned to longitudinalPlan.longitudinalPlanSource
body:
### Describe the bug

I was monitoring the topic while running the replay and found some strange values.

```python
import cereal.messaging as messaging

sm = messaging.SubMaster(["longitudinalPlan"])
while True:
        sm.update()
        print(sm["longitudinalPlan"])
```

The replay was run with the following command, and at around 590 seconds (where it pauses at the intersection), I observed a strange value in `longitudinalPlan.longitudinalPlanSource`.

```bash
cd tools/replay
./replay --demo --ecam --dcam
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44621609/189565594-809deaf9-960d-4a7f-b0a0-23d6168f590c.png)

This is the value of `longitudinalPlan` observed around 590s of replay.

```bash
( lateralValidDEPRECATED = false,
...
  vTargetFutureDEPRECATED = 0,
  longitudinalPlanSource = (5),
  vCruiseDEPRECATED = 0,
  aCruiseDEPRECATED = 0,
...
  solverExecutionTime = 0 )

```
And the next is the value of `longitudinalPlan` in the normal case.

```
( lateralValidDEPRECATED = false,
...
  laneWidthDEPRECATED = 0,
  vTargetFutureDEPRECATED = 0,
  longitudinalPlanSource = cruise,
  vCruiseDEPRECATED = 0,
  aCruiseDEPRECATED = 0,
...
  solverExecutionTime = 0 )
```

Since `longitudinalPlanSource` is an enumerated type to which values from 0 to 4 are assigned, the number 5 is considered a bug.

[cereal/log.capnp at cea51afd67b5c56f7a18207ef91c5e45d6345526 · commaai/cereal](https://github.com/commaai/cereal/blob/cea51afd67b5c56f7a18207ef91c5e45d6345526/log.capnp)

```capnp
  enum LongitudinalPlanSource {
    cruise @0;
    lead0 @1;
    lead1 @2;
    lead2 @3;
    e2e @4;
  }
```

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

4cf7a6ad03080c90|2021-09-29--13-46-36

### openpilot version

cd7de851b17

### Additional info

If I run `tools/replay/ui.py` while playing the replay, I got an error at some point (when `longitudinalPlanSource` is assigned 5).

I am wondering how an out of range value can be assigned to `longitudinalPlanSource`.

```bash
$ python ui.py 
pygame 2.1.2 (SDL 2.0.16, Python 3.8.10)
Hello from the pygame community. https://www.pygame.org/contribute.html
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "ui.py", line 228, in <module>
    ui_thread(args.ip_address)
  File "ui.py", line 194, in ui_thread
    info_font.render("LONG MPC SOURCE: " + str(sm['longitudinalPlan'].longitudinalPlanSource), True, YELLOW),
  File "capnp/lib/capnp.pyx", line 1019, in capnp.lib.capnp._DynamicEnum.__str__
  File "capnp/lib/capnp.pyx", line 1011, in capnp.lib.capnp._DynamicEnum._as_str
RuntimeError: Member was null.

```

title: Toyota: Prolonged low speed lateral oscillation
body:
### Describe the bug

This is an instance of steering oscillation commonly experienced when driving tssp corolla at low speeds (20->35mph).

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3820605/186998526-4404dbbe-1ecd-45ef-bbab-e99b05373967.mp4

(segment 9)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3820605/186997771-bbe5cb81-7e68-4ad7-a4be-7dc990d9dd1b.png)

segments 10 and 11 also display oscillating torque output/steering angle.

### Which car does this affect?

Toyota Corolla 2017

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

a152dad3c3368320|2022-08-26--15-36-30--9

### openpilot version

38eb19bf04a5b6498cc38377796134205f0ee725

### Additional info

#### 
latcontrol torque error equations
```
setpoint = desired_curvature * vego^2 + desired_curvature * low_speed_factor
setpoint = desired_curvature * (vego^2 + low_speed_factor)
measurement = actual_curvature * (vego^2 + low_speed_factor)

==>

error = (desired_curvature - actual_curvature) * (vego^2 + low_speed_factor)
```

error is difference in curvature multiplied by `vego^2 + low_speed_factor`

#### graph of `vego^2 + low_speed_factor`
https://www.wolframalpha.com/input?i=y+%3D+piecewise%5B%7B%7B500%2C+x+%3C+10%7D%2C+%7B800+-+30x%2C+x+%3C+20%7D%2C+%7B200%2C+x+%3E+20%7D%7D%5D+%2B+x%5E2
```
y = piecewise[{{500, x < 10}, {800 - 30x, x < 20}, {200, x > 20}}] + x^2
```

title: Regression: Rav4 2019 FWD Fingerprint Failure
body:
### Describe the bug

Toyota Rav4 2019 FWD does not fingerprint on release3 branch. Getting unknown vehicle error. 

Steps to re-create:
Try using release3 branch on specified vehicle. 

Using Erich's `values.py fix` pin in #toyota-lexus resolves this issue. 
This has been broken for a while. I initially ran into this issue when upgrading from v7.X dragonpilot to v8.X release3 on C2.
Now using a different C3 using release3, I am getting the same error.
Previously on v7.X release2 and dragonpilot I did not experience this fingerprinting issue. 

### Which car does this affect?

Toyota Rav4 2019 

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

28947140cc79e4cf|2022-08-23--12-10-11--3

### openpilot version

0.8.15

### Additional info

Fixed by disabling auto-updates and manually replacing values.py. As per Erich's pin in #toyota-lexus.

```
echo -en "1" > /data/params/d/DisableUpdates
cd /data/openpilot/selfdrive/car/toyota && rm -f values.py
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ErichMoraga/openpilot/815/selfdrive/car/toyota/values.py && python -m compileall values.py
```

title: GM: Runaway set speed increase when no acc buttons pressed
body:
### Describe the bug

While testing for [this PR](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/25422) using the following procedure, I encountered a bug where the set speed was increasing in increments of 5mph anytime openpilot was engaged, regardless of ACC button presses.

However, after off-road/on-road cycling my C3, a subsequent attempt of the procedure did not reproduce the bug. This is a preliminary report, and I don't yet know how to reproduce the bug consistently. This has only happened once to me. I suspect the bug is due to me having been holding the res/accel button as openpilot came to a stop behind the lead (which involves a change in ACC cruise state), but again, repeating the below procedure didn't reproduce the bug.

Bug description:
Once the bug as been triggered, op increases the set speed as if you're pressing and holding the res/accel button, resulting in 5mph increments to the set speed every half second.
Presses of the set/decel button or the res/accel button will result in 1mph decrements or increments to the set speed, in addition to those cased by the persistent phantom res/accel button hold.

Testing procedure :
1. engage and set speed to 5mph
2. Pull behind parked car and as op slows, increase set speed to 90mph (I stopped at 85, but same thing). op will still slow and stop behind parked lead
3. Once stopped, you can use the set/decel button to lower speed 1mph at a time and confirm visually that the dash speed matches the onscreen op set speed.



### Which car does this affect?

GM Chevy Volt

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

c11fcb510a549332|2022-08-13--10-34-36

### openpilot version

67cd27a9e153eef6359a85575c6fe803f9be602a

### Additional info

Commit has corresponds to latest commit of the [gm-cruise-speed-scaling](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/compare/gm-cruise-speed-scaling) branch.

title: Toyota: 2019 Rav4-Hybrid Limited Silently Will Not Engage in Trail Mode
body:
### Describe the bug

I know there are restrictions about being in drive in order to engage Openpilot.  

This one was a surprise for me.  I think I accidentally hit the trail mode in my car.  When I tried to engage openpilot, nothing happened.  No warning, no nothing.  If I came to a stop, it seemed like it would engage, until I released the brake and then it would disengage without explanation.

I eventually discovered what I had done. And then tested turning on trail mode while Openpilot was engaged and openpilot immediately disengaged without explanation.

I am not clear on exactly what trail mode changes in my car, I suspect something to do with the limited torque vectoring that AWD offers.  The button is near the eco and sport modes that only change the accelerator profile.  Notably, OP works just fine with the sport or eco modes enabled as they don't really do anything.

At minimum, the user should get a notice why openpilot won't engage, or disengages.  The "car not in D" warning would at least be a good start, although still a bit misleading as the car is still in D.

### Which car does this affect?

2019 Rav4-Hybrid Limited

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

2a96bb3fffd2e049|2022-08-06--13-28-53

### openpilot version

0.8.15

### Additional info

_No response_

title: Toyota: `NO_STOP_TIMER_CAR` hybrids consume power when stopped
body:
### Describe the bug

It has come to my attention thanks to a Discord user's tip-off that Toyota `NO_STOP_TIMER_CAR` hybrids may unnecessarily waste power when the vehicle is at a standstill with openpilot longitudinal engaged. The user reported the car uses around 400 watts of extra power when stopped with openpilot engaged, but only wastes around 100 watts with the stock system under the same conditions.

I believe this is due to openpilot's implementation of the `NO_STOP_TIMER_CAR` logic, where some hybrid cars won't go into standstill when *openpilot longitudinal is stopping behind a lead vehicle* (this issue does not apply when the user is manually stopping behind a lead car and enabling openpilot after they have came to a complete stop).

I have been procrastinating to report this issue due to lack of access to proper equipment, my Chinese clone of the XHorse cable was unstable at best, it recently kicked the bucket, so I have decided to purchase an OBDLink LX. With that piece of equipment in hand, I have been able to personally verify this with my MY2018 Prius.

I will try to conduct some tests on this issue, and document my findings here. Please, if you have access to the proper hardware, test this on your vehicle as well, the more data the better.

### Which car does this affect?

Presumably all toyota hybrids marked as no stop timer car

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

NA

### openpilot version

all

### Additional info

_No response_

title: EV6 Wind (HDA 1) - no OP steering
body:
### Describe the bug

OP does not steer the Kia EV6 Wind trim. This trim level has HDA1 instead of HDA2. I have no errors on my C3, all the buttons work, and auto-resume works. The EV6 Wind trim does not have an LKAS (0x50) signal, does not have the 0x2a4 signal, and only has a LFA signal (0x12a) on bus 5. This can be seen in Cabana with ID 5:12a. 

So far, I have removed references to 0x2a4 from all files in OP and in the Panda file safety_hyundai_hda2.h. In safety_hyundai_hda2.h, I have tried replacing 0x50 with 0x12a. I have also tried setting the tx bus for 0x12a to can bus 1. 

My changes can be seen on:
https://github.com/hoomoose/openpilot/tree/ev6  
https://github.com/hoomoose/panda

Here is a Cabana link:

title: hyundai: fix carState.stockAeb/carState.stockFcw
body:
The current logic isn't correct
https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/0c95493dc0cbc5d3dec59a50ac5476573041942d/selfdrive/car/hyundai/carstate.py#L112-L117

stock seems to use `CF_VSM_Warn == 1` for warning the driver and higher values for braking, although it is possible to command braking even when `CF_VSM_Warn == 1`

stock definitely uses `CF_VSM_Warn == 2` with `CF_VSM_DecCmdAct = 1` as well as `CF_VSM_Warn == 3` with `FCA_CmdAct = 1` to command braking (and in both cases uses `CR_VSM_DecCmd` for the amount of braking requested)

Here is my best guess but there still may be edge cases where it doesn't brake until you start pressing the brake pedal or something
* stockFcw = `CF_VSM_Warn != 0 and CF_VSM_DecCmdAct == 0 and FCA_CmdAct == 0`
* stockAeb = `CF_VSM_Warn != 0 and (CF_VSM_DecCmdAct != 0 or FCA_CmdAct != 0)`

Example routes:
02c45f73a2e5c6e9|2020-06-24--12-20-18
c7d0d7dde77d49ce|2022-06-24--19-02-59

title: Command injection in juggle.py
body:
### Describe the bug

hi, great project!

In `tools/plotjuggler/juggle.py` I found that the parameter layout is directly spliced into the command and executed, which may cause the command injection vulnerability, and when the file is executed with root privileges, it may lead to privilege escalation.

```py
def start_juggler(fn=None, dbc=None, layout=None):
  env = os.environ.copy()
  env["BASEDIR"] = BASEDIR
  env["PATH"] = f"{INSTALL_DIR}:{os.getenv('PATH', '')}"
  if dbc:
    env["DBC_NAME"] = dbc

  extra_args = ""
  if fn is not None:
    extra_args += f" -d {fn}"
  if layout is not None:
    extra_args += f" -l {layout}"

  cmd = f'{PLOTJUGGLER_BIN} --plugin_folders {INSTALL_DIR}{extra_args}'
  subprocess.call(cmd, shell=True, env=env, cwd=juggle_dir)
```
```py
  parser.add_argument("--layout", nargs='?', help="Run PlotJuggler with a pre-defined layout")
```

title: Hyundai longitudinal: handle button signal changing mid press
body:
If you hold the accel or decel button and then quickly switch to the other (which is pretty easy actually), the signal for the buttons in CLU11 never goes to 0, so we never add a button event with `decelCruise` or `accelCruise` not being pressed, thus causing its button timer to increment until it's pressed again. It can cause the set speed to jump by 5 mph all the way down to the minimum or maximum allowed cruise speed the next time you engage with any other button.

Example:

```python
buttonEvents: [<car.capnp:CarState.ButtonEvent builder (pressed = true, type = decelCruise)>]
2.0 0.0 deque([2.0, 2.0, 2.0, 0.0], maxlen=4)
buttonEvents: [<car.capnp:CarState.ButtonEvent builder (pressed = false, type = decelCruise)>]
0.0 2.0 deque([0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 2.0], maxlen=4)
buttonEvents: [<car.capnp:CarState.ButtonEvent builder (pressed = true, type = decelCruise)>]
2.0 4.0 deque([2.0, 2.0, 2.0, 4.0], maxlen=4)
buttonEvents: [<car.capnp:CarState.ButtonEvent builder (pressed = true, type = cancel)>]
4.0 0.0 deque([4.0, 4.0, 4.0, 0.0], maxlen=4)
buttonEvents: [<car.capnp:CarState.ButtonEvent builder (pressed = false, type = cancel)>]
0.0 4.0 deque([0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 4.0], maxlen=4)
```

title: paramsd: Updating linear region
body:
### Describe the bug

`paramsd` observes values when in linear region, which is described as:
1. The car is driven by OP
2. The abs(steering_angle) < 45 degrees

But there is the case where OP is driving, and the steering angle >> 45 degree (like an assisted 180deg turn where the user lets go of the wheel after the turn, and it is spinning back). This is not in the linear region, but we observe values currently.

@ClockeNessMnstr highlighted the issue in https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/24182/files. 

ToDo:
- Quantify the problem and risk
- Either redefine the linear region or let it be if there are no issues

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

-

### openpilot version

All versions

### Additional info

_No response_

title: Revert GM brake pressed signal and show alert for noisy pedal disengages
body:
This PR is causing ACC faults on cars that have a noisy brake pedal: https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/23712

The car's ACC system actually uses the noisy `ECMAcceleratorPos->BrakePedalPos` signal with a threshold of 8, and whenever it rises above that, the ACC system wants to disengage. openpilot knows the user didn't actually press the brake, so it stays engaged causing an ACC fault.

Ideally we should detect this and alert the user when we disengage to prevent a fault

title: Chrysler: find ACC faulted signal
body:
Right now we don't set this in openpilot, so controlsd just disengages like normal if ACC gets into a faulted state.

When ACC becomes faulted, it just looks like the PCM disengaged; `CRUISE_STATE` goes to 0 and `ACC_STATUS_2` goes to 1, the same values for when main is off, so find something else.

Preserved routes:
- `4395faadf0a373f2|2022-04-26--15-47-07`

title: Sticking brake command for 2019 Toyota Sienna with SDSU
body:
### Describe the bug

openpilot allows both gas and brake commands to be applied with a SDSU. Initially when disengaging openpilot on gas pedal with openpilot slowing down, the brake command will stick (further tests reveal other methods bug shows up). When gas is applied, the brake will still be engaged and will not release until car is turned off for about 30 seconds. The force of the brake applied seems to be the "last brake" command...as if I'm going 55 mph and openpilot decides to go 45 mph (car in front), the brake command to get to 45 mph will maintain, so when the car tries to get back to 55 mph, openpilot has to overcome the brake command...eventually resulting in overheating on the brakes. As the car slows down further, through manual intervention (openpilot disengaged), the brake command still sticks and gets worse until car is turned off. 

Occurs on both stock openpilot 0.8.13 (Comma 2) and 0.8.14 Master-ci big model (Comma 3). First occurrence after openpilot engaged, with brake command being maintained with openpilot engaged and maintained after openpilot disengaged. Occurs on disengagement via user brake press, user gas press, manual cruse control turned off. 

Next steps for testing will be to keep SDSU disconnected and use a fork to prove the stuck brake issue is from SDSU (have to use fork due to fp v1 on Toyota with disconnected DSU).

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three, comma two

### Which car does this affect?

Toyota Sienna 2019

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

7cbeaba98d732562|2022-04-05--14-16-08--0

### openpilot version

0.8.13, 0.8.14 Master-ci big model

### Additional info

- Route after the issue without OpenPilot engaged...issue still happens: 7cbeaba98d732562|2022-04-05--14-22-03--1
- Route after disconnecting SDSU: 7cbeaba98d732562|2022-04-05--14-28-42--1
- First captured occurrence: ad9d2279abbc8220c|2022-03-21--18-13-21--4

title: Hyundai: always update set speed
body:
`SCC11->VSetDis` stays at its last value when not enabled, but we reset it to 0 making it disappear from the UI. This wasn't an issue until we started always updating the controlsd `v_cruise_kph` in https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/24052.

Not sure why this was added, the original commit just adds it in the first Hyundai port, but the check was originally `if self.CS.pcm_acc_status != 0:`

Close if there's nothing we need to do

title: Having the C3 plugged in (running openpilot) breaks remote start - Toyota RAV4 2019
body:
Hello!

So I just had remote start installed on my vehicle (in the UK - we don't get it from factory like the US folks!) via a Pandora alarm system. Essentially it emulates a human - holds the break, hits the start button, yada yada.

Now it's installed - it works 100% of the time when I don't have the C3 (running OP) plugged in but as soon as I plug it in - it starts to fail the process. I believe the C3 is querying the car the second it gets power and slowing down things on the car just enough to cause the remote start to fail (a race condition.)

Obviously this is an annoying issue so what I'm thinking is - would it be possible to either:

1. Add an option in stock OP to delay comms with the vehicle for a period of time?
2. Fork OP and add this option myself?
3. Add some kind of bash script type workaround somewhere in OP (since the C3 runs Ubuntu anyway) to intentionally slow this down?

Any help here would be greatly appreciated as unplugging / re-plugging the C3 every time is getting old real fast! :)

Thanks!

title: DM alerting me to pay attention only during sunset period.
body:
### Describe the bug

Drove during daytime without a single DM issue.  Then on the return trip just after sunset, thus the sky is still somewhat bright and my car was facing west, DM was alerting me to pay attention almost nonstop.  After stopping to shop and a gas fill up, the sky was still a little bright and the DM resumed alerting me.  About 10 minutes later when the sky is pretty dark then everything is back to normal again.
I have noticed when it's alerting me, the DM icon was dimmed.  i.e. the camera couldn't see me.  I wiped the lens with a tissue but had no effect.
On the driver preview screen, my face is to the upper left corner of the highlighted rectangle, and my hair is above it; and I do wear glasses.
I did slide my body down a little to allow my face to be within the bound of the highlighted rectangle and it helped minimize the alerts.  
Would be great if the highlighted rectangle's position can be adjusted by the user.


### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

9ff6adaf72343a2c|2022-03-05--18-10-27

### openpilot version

0.8.13

### Additional info

Only mod was changing CAMERA_OFFSET to -0.13 in lane_planner.py.
C3 was mounted dead center with both calibrations less than 1.  I did mount it about 2 inches lower in order not to block my dash cam.
Car is 2017 Toyota Highlander Hybrid.

title: Git high CPU/RAM usage
body:
git garbage collection sometimes uses a lot of memory until it gets OOM killed. This can happen while onroad and cause lags.

- [ ] Ensure `git gc` is only ever started by `updated` and running in the overlay, never triggered by something like`version.py`.
- [ ] Ensure updated is immediately canceling any ongoing git/copy operations when going onroad.

title: Honda: Cruise Fault when OP drives below car's stock lower cruise speed limit
body:
### Describe the bug

Odyssey stock lower speed limit is 22mph.  The following is for an Odyssey without a Comma Pedal.

Expected behavior: when OP is engaged and drives the car below this limit, an info splash tells the user that they are below the limit while OP continues to be able to brake and steer.  Once OP tries to send an acceleration command, OP is disengaged entirely.  OP can be re-engaged once speed is above 25mph.

Current behavior: as soon as car drives below the lower limit while OP is engaged, a Cruise Fault warning comes up forcing the car to be restarted in order to continue using OP.  This also causes dash warnings to be set off, Collision Mitigation and possibly another, until the car is restarted.

The current behavior started after installing 0.8.13

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma two

### Which car does this affect?

Honda Odyssey 2020

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

0a96f86fcfe35964|2022-02-22--07-40-51

### openpilot version

0.8.13 release2

### Additional info

Edit: Cruise Fault error is not triggered if car goes below min speed without brake commands (e.g. set max OP speed to 25mph - minimum allowed without Pedal - and let hilly road pull vEgo below 22mph)
0a96f86fcfe35964|2022-02-23--07-40-44

title: Toyota TSS 2.5: openpilot can learn bad angle offset if initialized in a turn
body:
### Describe the bug

Something I noticed on my TSS 2.5 Camry Hybrid is that `STEER_TORQUE_SENSOR`'s angle signal is absolute and not relative, meaning it doesn't start at 0 and very closely follows the angle in `STEER_ANGLE_SENSOR` without any offset (unlike TSS2 where `STEER_TORQUE_SENSOR`'s angle is relative.

Meaning if openpilot goes onroad while the car is driving and we're in a turn, a bad offset can be learned. This isn't a problem with torque control, as the desired angle is also offset in this way, however, when testing the LTA message which uses desired angles, the issue is very apparent as the car tried to veer left multiple times after engagement.

https://imgur.com/a/s31NKlQ

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

f15e3c37c118e841|2022-02-20--16-53-06--0

### openpilot version

0.8.14

### Additional info

The `STEER_TORQUE_SENSOR` took 1.7 seconds to initialize properly and start sending real angles (was -0.3438 until then). https://imgur.com/a/2SlhZFm

title: Hyundai: VIN request fails on some cars
body:
### Describe the bug

We are working on a car port for a 2022 Hyundai Kona Electric (#23517), and the car will not get recognized and kept throwing "CAN Error" as soon as it goes onroad. Upon investigation, we found that the car's VIN wasn't even read correctly: `OSEV__ BMS \x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00`. We attempted with multiple power cycles and the issue persisted.

We then attempted to introduce a delay with the fingerprinting query similar to how Subaru is trying to do, and found that the VIN was changed to `00000000000000000`, but broken or unqueried FW versions all over the place.

Maybe this is somewhat related to the inconsistent fingerprinting we had issues with a couple of months ago? (#21333)

**Bad VIN, fully queried FW versions (unconfirmed):**
- `248133d966e0182c|2022-01-14--05-28-05`
- `248133d966e0182c|2022-01-14--04-01-46`
```
{'carFingerprint': 'HYUNDAI KONA ELECTRIC 2022',
               'carFw': [{'address': 1988,
                          'ecu': 'fwdCamera',
                          'fwVersion': b'\xf1\x00OSP LKA  AT CND LHD 1.00 1.02 99211-J9110 802',
                          'subAddress': 0},
                         {'address': 2001,
                          'ecu': 'esp',
                          'fwVersion': b'\xf1\x8758520-K4010\xf1\x00OS IEB \x02 101 \x11\x13 58520-K4010',
                          'subAddress': 0},
                         {'address': 2004, 'ecu': 'eps', 'fwVersion': b'\xf1\x00OSP MDPS C 1.00 1.02 56310K4260\x00 4OEPC102', 'subAddress': 0},
                         {'address': 2000,
                          'ecu': 'fwdRadar',
                          'fwVersion': b'\xf1\x00YB__ FCA -----      1.00 1.01 99110-K4500      \x00\x00\x00',
                          'subAddress': 0}],
               'carName': 'hyundai',
               'carVin': 'OSEV__ BMS \x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00',
```

**`00000000000000000` VIN, but broken/unqueried FW versions:**
- `248133d966e0182c|2022-01-14--05-09-54`
- `248133d966e0182c|2022-01-14--04-56-48`
```
{'carParams': {'carFingerprint': 'mock',
               'carFw': [{'address': 2000,
                          'ecu': 'fwdRadar',
                          'fwVersion': b'\xf1\x00YB__ FCA -----      1.00 1.01 99110-K4500      \x00\x00\x00',
                          'subAddress': 0}],
               'carName': 'mock',
               'carVin': '00000000000000000',
```

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma two

### Which car does this affect?

Hyundai Kona Electric 2022

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

248133d966e0182c|2022-01-14--05-28-05

### openpilot version

0.8.13

### Additional info

_No response_

title: CAN messages in plotjugger across different buses has timing that doesn't make sense
body:
~I noticed the hyundai car controller when using hyundai longitudinal the `enabled` flag can get out of sync with controls state~
Depending on what bus you look at, the same message can appear to have very different timing (large enough that it cannot just be how long it took to send a message, see comments below)

example: `5decac85ab437ed1|2021-12-24--12-48-45--75`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4112046/147810678-a3440d6d-4ee4-409e-af4a-93e09bd81058.png)

title: Nav/Athena behavior when disconnected
body:
### Describe the bug

Tried to use navigation on the return leg of my road trip Sunday and had several weird issues:

1. The UI showed connect offline, although I seemed to be in good LTE coverage
2. I chose my preprogrammed home location from the C3 UI as my nav destination
3. Navigation never really started, but the Nav UI pane did come up
4. I tried to cancel navigation, but the Nav menu disappeared in favor of the Nav/Prime ad screen
5. Rotating among UI views, the Nav UI pane was still accessible despite this
6. If I selected the usual full-screen onroad view, the Nav pane would reappear on its own within about a minute

I drove in this state for about 90 minutes. To get connectivity back and make the nav pane stop popping up, I had to reboot the device at my next stop.

There were a bunch of times I tried to dismiss the Nav pane and had it come back. The instances I made note of were right at the end of the route, about 6:36PM and 6:41PM (might be off by a timezone). It popped back up after about a minute each time. I actually had the UI process die and restart on me right at the end too, but that could be the usual watchdog thing.

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

`3cfdec54aa035f3f|2021-12-19--17-16-31`

### openpilot version

master @ 16dd7ce1fe2a2b0537fefd5ad131d1494d0d09ad

### Additional info

There's several issues to unpack here.

The C3 UI showed I had good LTE coverage. I don't know if I had working Internet connectivity; I wasn't in a position to SSH in and check. Athena certainly thought I was offline. Device reboot was definitely needed to get it back.

Earlier that day, several drive-cycles (but not power-cycles) prior, I did spend time in an area that legitimately had no cell service. I drove into the area, stopped and parked for an hour, and started a new drive out of that area. I don't know when the Athena no-connectivity issue started, but it's possible that it never recovered from earlier that day.

Even if I had no Internet connectivity, the UI shouldn't have treated me as if I weren't a Prime/Nav subscriber.

It shouldn't be possible to lose the Nav settings/destination menu while still having the Nav onroad pane in rotation.

The Nav pane shouldn't have kept popping up unsolicited. That was weird. Maybe a nexus with #23281?

title: Nav UI route stats/turn instruction misbehavior
body:
### Describe the bug

I used openpilot navigation on a drive from Cincinnati to St. Louis. It worked fine in the beginning, but some time into the drive, the nav UI began some manner of freakout. I don't know what triggered it. I was engaged and driving normally, and I don't think I was interacting with the UI when it started.

![ezgif com-gif-maker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46612682/146836683-b1481c03-8047-421e-9621-e266a24e9e1c.gif)

The above GIF shows it rapidly cycling between different versions of the travel time, estimated time of arrival, distance remaining, and next turn instruction. I think it may have been cycling through future navigation plan segments. The references to I-70 toward St. Louis were along my planned route, but an hour or more in the future.

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

`3cfdec54aa035f3f|2021-12-18--05-01-39`

### openpilot version

master @ e4de82f90636a551a2490ccda1abc30a9b7f30b1

### Additional info

The misbehavior, and my attempts to reset and troubleshoot, are in the 05:15-05:30 range of the above route.

I was able to cancel navigation just fine, but on restarting navigation to the same place in St. Louis, the UI misbehaved immediately in the same way. I then tried navigation to two other destinations, one of which was a direct U-turn back home, and the same misbehavior continued. IIRC it was still showing basically the same stats/turn info in rotation, which means it was still stuck from the prior nav destination. I wasn't all that far from home yet, and I-70 wouldn't have been involved in a return route.

title: Comma 3 not shutting down after car is turned off
body:
### Describe the bug

My comma 3 is not properly shutting down after my 2019 Subaru Forester is turned off and the driver exits the vehicle.
It continuously uploads video to connect.comma.ai to the point that Comma banned my device.  It has been reinstated now, and I make sure to unplug the comma 3 every time I leave the car.
Because it is not shutting down it also seems to ignore/bypass the code that is supposed to shut it off if my car's battery voltage becomes too low.  This has caused my car's battery to be fully drained on a couple of occasions after a few day of not driving the car and not unplugging the comma 3.

There is a video attached that starts at step 3 below.  Ways to reproduce the video:
1. Turn on the car and the comma
2. Turn off the car and exit the vehicle
3. The comma's screen will go black, but then after a few seconds will start displaying the "landing" page.
4. The screen will briefly show what the camera sees and then it will show the landing page again.
5. Wait long enough and the car battery is dead and the comma has uploaded a large amount of video files. 

Before flashing agnos, it would show the landing page, then show what the camera sees with the words "Openpilot unavailable waiting for controls to start."

Things I've tried:
1. Disconnect and reconnect all cables
2. Uninstall/reinstall Openpilot
3. Flash agnos
4. Ask the Subaru discord channel if anyone has seen this (no one had)
5. Contact support which asked that I file this bug report.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7681453/144728489-5f9f0944-c984-4617-86c3-882c00578665.mp4



### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Provide a route where the issue occurs

0.8.11

### Additional info

_No response_

title: 2019 Kia Sorento: e2e_long not stopping for stop lights/signs
body:
### Describe the bug

I switched to the `e2e_long` branch and enabled OP long by setting `DisableRadar_Allow` to `1` and while driving, the yellow triangle appeared behind a lead car so I’m fairly certain I enabled it correctly. When starting the car there was a FCW and cruise fault alert on the instrument cluster but that went away after a few seconds and I could then press the Cruise button on my steering wheel and engage OP with no issue.

I went for a drive and noticed the car slowed down behind a lead car in a much smoother way than with radar, but when approaching red lights or stop signs the car would not slow down or stop. I thought I wasn’t waiting long enough for E2E long to see the light and respond, but it didn’t slow to stop even once for many stop lights.

Additionally, it wasn’t slowing for curves.

Another weird thing was when I would engage OP, the max speed was 25 MPH when my car usually has a minimum of 20 MPH. My instrument cluster would say 20 but the C3 would say 25.

I could also engage OP from 0 MPH (can’t usually) but it would throw an alert saying “steering unavailable” then go into “TAKE CONTROL IMMEDIATELY” mode for a few seconds. It would do the same thing if I attempted to resume OP (vs. hitting the set button) below 20 MPH.

There was another time where I disengaged but the car started accelerating. Kinda freaky.

### What hardware does this issue affect?

comma three

### Which car does this affect?

Kia Sorento 2019

title: Openpilot does not send CAN messages fast enough
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

Ever since OP 0.8.2, the CANsends logic was changed. Openpilot takes 1-2 seconds longer to start sending messages via Panda even with FP forced and the CANsends logic reversed back to what it was in 0.8.2

This 1-2 added seconds breaks previously working braking code for VW PQ vehicles. Edgy has made some progress on this with a Staff member at Comma but we have not been able to replicate his success on powertrain vehicles.

The message that needs to be sent is the MOB message.
https://github.com/CineXWorm/openpilot/blob/pq-fpv2-temp/selfdrive/car/volkswagen/volkswagencan.py#L84-L92

Any idea's?

Here is the fork/branch. The only edits to make it run on a powertrain vehicle are done in panda and in the vw selfdrive folder. just forcing HCA and all other commands to be sent onto PT.

https://github.com/CineXWorm/openpilot/tree/pq-fpv2-temp

### What hardware does this issue affect?

EON Gold

none posted to comma's storage, freon type device

_No response_

title: Match button engagement logic in panda/openpilot
body:
Openpilot tries to engage on the falling edge of the set/resume button. Panda safety modes (at least for Honda/Hyundai) sets `controls_allowed` while the button is pressed. This can cause a mismatch when the brake and the set button are released at the same time. In this case the panda never sets `controls_allowed`, but openpilot does try to engage because the brake is no longer pressed when the falling edge is triggered one cycle later.

- [x] Honda Nidec w/ pedal
- [x] Honda Bosch w/ longitudinal control
- [x] Hyundai w/ longitudinal control

title: Factory LDA warning can't be turned off
body:
### Describe the bug

With Factory LDA enabled and C3's default LDA warning disabled, getting factory LDA warning on the dash as well as the C3 screen every 30 seconds or so.  Have to manually move the steering wheel to get rid of it.
Attempts to disable factory LDA:
  1. With C3 powered on, failed to disable factory LDA using LDA button on steering wheel directly nor via factory menu settings and on/off switch on steering.  Both button has no affect.
  2. With C3 powered off (by pulling USB-C cable), turning off factory LDA works when using LDA switch on steering wheel or factory menu settings and on/off switch on steering wheel.  However, after booting C3, the LDA setting is turned on again, apparently by OpenPilot. 
 
So factory LDA can't be disabled with C3 and C3's LDA warning defaulted to off still won't hide the factory LDA warning resulted in the nagging warning with 30 seconds or so.

title: Install loop (multiple full system restores / will not flash)
body:
### Describe the bug

Originally, for a while, for some reason it just stopped connecting to my comma application. Whenever I'd unpair and try and repair, it would say it didn't recognize my QR code being displayed. This was before it moved over to the website and was still in the application. It also would not pair on the website either. Then it was constantly hounding for an update even when it was connected to wifi. No matter how many times I'd try and update it it would never start an automatic update. I decided to just go ahead and factory reset it to make it shiny and new. When I factory reset the Comma Two I was able to get to the "Let's get started" or "Continue setup" screen, when I'd go to put in Https://openpilot.comma.ai, it would very briefly say "download is starting wait for installation, along those lines and then would just flash back to the "Get started / Begin resume setup" (I can't remember the verbage) no matter what I do, it won't let me get past that screen.

I tried to install the sshane fork thinking maybe if I can get a fork on there it'll let me at least get to the ssh setup so I could SSH in. Did another factory reset and tried to https://smiskol.com/fork/openpilot at the setup screen again, no dice. It gets a bit further than the default openpilot but will not go further. Went through the flashing and am able to set the device into fastboot mode but when executing the flash.ps1 it just shows looking for any device. I can't flash it, I can't SSH, I can't manually install a fork or the default release. I'm at a loss. I don't have any dongle ID's, I believe the version was 0.8.2 as it would never go past it. Any help would be appreciated.

comma two

### openpilot version

0.8.2

### Additional info

_No response_

title: Lead car with no lights not detected
body:
I'm not sure what this issue was... but it was a strange one.

I was driving along and this black Kia Soul with rear wreck damage and no lights entered my lane in front of me around dawn. Openpilot was engaged and it did not detect this car at all it seems. It would accelerate through the car if I hadn't intervened. I ended up approaching this car 3 times and each time it did not detect it. This particular bug is extremely dangerous as it would have rammed this car without manual intervention.

First incident:
comma 3
master-ci 0.8.8
dfb993cc43ba69dc|2021-09-24--06-53-09--37 through 40
07:30::33
2020 Toyota Corolla Hatchback

Second incident:
07:32::12
the car was stopping for this turn/exit and OP was not braking appropriately

Third incident:
07:33:25
I ran up the set speed to catch the car... and OP was accelerating very rapidly like the car wasn't there.

Not sure if this car is special or if something in the model changed... but this behavior was very uncharacteristic and worrisome. Had this car been stopped at a red light and had a driver been completely distracted (shame on them!) OP would have happily crashed into it at full speed.

Note to everyone, you must be ready to take over at all times!

title: Locationd not using carState packets as expected, possible timing issue
body:
In this segment
` 09c32a592a49b2da|2021-08-04--13-41-56/18 `

The carState.standstill flag is always true. This should cause serious issues with the locationd that expects this value to be correct and enforces standstill when it is true. Somehow locationd did not react to this at runtime at all (it does in offline reruns). I suspect there are timing issues between the messages causing messages to be dropped, but unconfirmed.

title: No LTE after fresh install on new C3
body:
**Describe the bug**

After installing release3 openpilot using the normal methods on a factory-fresh C3, LTE connectivity wasn't working. This was discovered and noted as part of a separate issue #22105.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Unknown.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: CCC3
 - Dongle ID: 3cfdec54aa035f3f
 - Route: N/A / all
 - Timestamp: N/A / all prior to late this afternoon
 - Version: 0.8.8 release3
 - Car make/model: 2018 Volkswagen Golf R

**Additional context**

Upon further digging, it was found the default LTE system connection was either never created, or not completely created, or the connection profile didn't make it to stable storage _[edit: it was found to be deleted programmatically]_. In the output below, the UUID-nmmeta symlink to `/dev/null` is of the same UUID as the system default LTE connection.

I don't really know how I got to this state, or if anyone else might conceivably be affected. If so, this does seem something easy to detect and mitigate in startup scripts. I fixed the issue manually by removing the nmmeta link and copying the default LTE connection from `/usr/lib/NetworkManager` and restarting NetworkManager. _[edit: there's no need to manually copy the system default LTE connection, just delete the nmmeta shadowing link.]_ In retrospect, I think it likely a factory reset would also have fixed it.

**Example NetworkManager info from a good C3 with operating LTE:**
```
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ nmcli conn show
NAME                              UUID                                  TYPE  DEVICE   
openpilot connection young        fa834e4b-2ad9-4ca8-b6bb-013f50914db7  wifi  wlan0    
lte                               6586fb1f-4a66-46d4-9164-0100b73750ee  gsm   cdc-wdm0 
Hotspot                           cbdf53cc-83dc-4539-9161-a7e6aeb0c4be  wifi  --       
openpilot connection jypixel      8939f9c8-ae58-46ed-b12c-6f138ad84980  wifi  --       
openpilot connection STRESS_TEST  27629e64-81f1-4b93-afe8-9956022a34ef  wifi  --  
```

```
comma@tici:/data/etc/NetworkManager/system-connections$ ll
total 24
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Aug 11 19:24  ./
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 May 27 11:16  ../
-rw------- 1 root root  441 Aug 11 19:24  Hotspot.nmconnection
-rw------- 1 root root  363 Aug  2 23:35 'openpilot connection jypixel.nmconnection'
-rw------- 1 root root  308 Jul 30 20:27 'openpilot connection STRESS_TEST.nmconnection'
-rw------- 1 root root  376 Aug  3 00:34 'openpilot connection young.nmconnection'
```

**Example NetworkManager info from this C3 in a bad state:**
```
comma@tici:/data/openpilot$ nmcli conn show
NAME                        UUID                                  TYPE  DEVICE 
openpilot connection young  67419148-9117-4993-bd7f-a5b65a957ebd  wifi  wlan0
```

```
comma@tici:/data/etc/NetworkManager/system-connections$ ll
total 12
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Aug 31 17:50  ./
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 Jul 21 15:00  ../
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root    9 Aug 31 17:50  6586fb1f-4a66-46d4-9164-0100b73750ee.nmmeta -> /dev/null
-rw------- 1 root root  376 Aug 31 11:16 'openpilot connection young.nmconnection'
```

title: Bad nav UI layout
body:
**Describe the bug**

The navigation UI is compressed to near-nothing on first-time use. I experienced this today as part of the out-of-the-box experience on a RMA swap. I installed stock openpilot, registered the device, started my Prime trial, and drove normally.

The problem DID NOT go away after cycling ignition, but DID go away after rebooting the device.

**How to reproduce or log data**

I think the condition is attempting to use the nav UI just after registering the device and activating Prime, and it seems to persist until openpilot is restarted. I believe I saw this on registration of my last device as well, but I didn't take notes at the time.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: CCC3
 - Dongle ID: 3cfdec54aa035f3f
 - Route: 3cfdec54aa035f3f|2021-08-31--11-32-41
 - Timestamp: All
 - Version: 0.8.8 release3
 - Car make/model: 2018 Volkswagen Golf R

**Additional context**

Seems to just be a UI layout problem.  Nav is "working"; in that vertical sliver on the far-right side I can see part of the ego-vehicle icon and bits of roads moving as I drive. The diagonal banding on the engaged pic is rolling shutter from my camera or something, they're not perceptible in reality.

![PXL_20210831_154130747](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46612682/131540078-8474df7d-ca4c-4e23-86be-dded590a788b.jpg)

title: Corolla Hatchback - RPM's Hung High
body:
I was driving along with OP engaged and upon a moderate hill OP had the throttle rev really high (like maybe 4,000 RPM?) while the car seemingly was not accelerating to the target speed. If I recall, the set speed was to be either 75 or 72 MPH. It hung at I believe 68 MPH. I jumped on the throttle to disengage OP and regain control of the car and upon reducing the throttle I was able to maintain the speed that hung at like 2,600 RPM's.

This has happened a few other times before, but it is inconsistent as to when it happens (even on the same hill and same set speeds). I've had it hit 5,000 RPM on a tiny little hill trying to hit 55 MPH.

comma 3
master-ci 0.8.9
dfb993cc43ba69dc|2021-08-27--07-14-58--22 and into 23
Sometime after 07:37::40 (it's hard to say for me without looking at the throttle graph)
2020 Toyota Corolla Hatchback

I'm not saying 4,000 RPM's wasn't needed to accelerate in that scenario, but it was odd to be that high and not actually accelerate. If I had to guess, I could accelerate to the set speed at 3,600 RPM's.

title: Honda: use new HUD msgs on newer Bosch models
body: I'm using stock OP 0.8.8. When I hit the LKAS button after OP is engaged using the set button, I get the lkas solid lines on the dash. After a few moments, I get "steering required" on the dashboard, if I don't grab the steering wheel within a few seconds, those solid lines become broken lines. The steering required message stays on until I grab the wheel. My C2 can see my face during this whole ordeal. My understanding is that the LKAS button is not suppose to do anything when OP is engaged.

title: Laneless master-ci 0.8.9 biases right and changes lanes by itself
body:
**Describe the bug**

It seems that in master-ci with git commit fa0d1ebc9b81aab17ecfaa4f07bbd1180da06932 and 34329f130dfb7e7adbfc37ec3c98a960008b0b55 OP likes to bias to the right quite heavily, and at least in this specific part of road, changes lanes to the right by itself, even if you try to put the car as far to the left as possible.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Drive down the road with OP engaged, when the car approaches that part of the road, it will either start to change lanes, or fully change lanes.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma two
 - Dongle ID: a8149c07cf2713da / 903210ecc0cb706b 
 - Route: a8149c07cf2713da|2021-08-27--22-27-30--10 / 903210ecc0cb706b|2021-08-28--00-35-42--36
 - Timestamp: a8149c07cf2713da|22:39:04 / 903210ecc0cb706b|01:12:11, 01:14:35, 01:16:56

 - Car make/model: 2019 VW Golf Manual


**Additional context**

Here's a google maps pin of where the issue occurs: https://www.google.com/maps/place/45%C2%B019'30.5%22N+75%C2%B041'25.4%22W/@45.3251389,-75.6909212,210m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x0:0x0!7e2!8m2!3d45.3251379!4d-75.6903742

I've been injured and unable to drive for the last while, so I have no idea when this issue started, or any context around it, but the model's behavior seems markedly different in laneless from before, but I'm not sure if it is the model to blame.

As always, I'll gladly test things if you guys want me to try that stretch in different conditions or with different versions or whatnot. I might be a bit slow though as I'm still recovering from my injury.

Let me know if you have any questions or need more info.

title: With 120° Wide Angle Lens, Driver Monitoring Does Not Detect Face Unless Shift Face/Body to Center of Cabin

Otherwise, driver monitoring is intermittent/inconsistent in face detection. In preview mode, driver monitoring is able to successfully track and find head/face, only when driving is area for detection shifted slightly to the center of cabin and driver monitoring unable to detect face.

title: Loss of C3 NVME with kernel panic
body:
**Describe the bug**

My rev-H production/retail C3 CrossCountry has lost its NVME at least twice.

The first time, the only noticeable symptom was a NVME not mounted alert in the UI. Examination of kernel logs show the NVME was lost within about 30 seconds of being mounted.

The second time, it was lost while onroad and engaged. The screen froze briefly, I had a Lane Assist fault, and the device rebooted on its own. Examination of kernel logs show the NVME PCIe device was lost, and a filesystem-related panic followed.

Unknown. This has never happened with my prior two units.

title: OpenGL context not guaranteed to be active on VisionIPC connect
body:
For the VisionIPC connect in the ui to work it needs an active OpenGL context. This used to be the case, but broke in one of the refactors. `ui_init_vision` is now called from `QUIState::update`. Make sure `ui_init_vision` is called from the `paintGL` function of a `QOpenGLWidget`, or `makeCurrent()` is called explicitly.

https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/358cdaaefd71dbfebbe07a5e6aaa19e35fae1827/selfdrive/ui/ui.cc#L301

There is some leftover code, but the condition is wrong and it's in the wrong place: https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/master/selfdrive/ui/qt/onroad.cc#L185

title: Openpilot fails to activate with error "Communication Issue between Processes:
body:
**Describe the bug**

For the past week I have been unable to use Openpilot. Suddenly an error "openpilot Unavailable: Communication Issue between Processes" is displayed every time I attempt to activate openpilot.

**How to reproduce or log data**

This issue can be easily reproduced by simply activating openpilot at any time.
The issue occurs 100% of the time.

**Device/Version information:**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 27858928f280bac1
 - Route: 27858928f280bac1|2021-08-04--20-45-36
 - Timestamp: 20:25:40, about 5 seconds into the drive. Occurs at every green blip in the route timeline.
 - Version: 0.8.7
 - Car make/model: Toyota Rav4 2021

**Additional context**

I have attempted to find solutions on line, and performed some steps in hopes of resolving the issue:
- Unplugged the Panda and its ethernet on both ends
- Unplugged the LKAS/LDA cable from the car harness 
- Unplugged the USB-C cable from the car harness to the Comma Two
- Plugged them all back in

This didn't work, so I also ensured that the Comma Two was working correctly:
- Uninstalled and re-installed OpenPilot 0.8.7
- Ensured the driver-facing camera was operating by viewing camera feed

title: Jerky Steering In Banked Corner
body:
**Describe the bug**

In a decently steep downward hill with a left turn, while OP was engaged, the car was smooth for a little bit into the corner and then made a sudden jerky movement in steering. In the past, this turn would cause ping ponging. Now instead of ping ponging it's very jerky at times. It feels like it was making the right moves, but needs a little more ramp up time on the move for this sweeping style of turn, instead of so suddenly. OP did not behave this way Friday and I first noticed this behavior on Monday. There are other segments of jerky as well on Monday but I can't find the timestamps just yet.

**How to reproduce or log data**

It's happened four times in like 3 hours of driving (maybe an hour 15 minutes of open pilot engaged), so pretty rare. I will say, the 4th time was a pretty well banked tight turn, and it helped OP make the turn better, so it seems like the radius of turn might impact the usefulness of the jerkiness.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: f39975d916ed458a
 - Route: f39975d916ed458a/2021-08-03--07-27-19/34
 - Timestamp: Segment 34, the local time was 8:01::34 not sure the exact timestamp
 - Version: Not sure the commit, I hope it is in the logs, but master-ci 0.8.7
 - Car make/model: 2020 Toyota Corolla Hatchback

**Additional context**

I don't believe it was windy. I did notice on replay that maybe it had to do with the bumps or concrete expansion joints in the road? Hard to say. I can look for the other one's if there is something to it, let me know. Tomorrow should bring more as well.

title: BSM not working on 2019 Toyota CH-R
body:
BSM not working on Toyota CH-R

Toyota interface.py is filtering out no_dsu_cars for BSM.

The following line is in the toyota interface.py:

ret.enableBsm = 0x3F6 in fingerprint[0] and candidate in TSS2_CAR
/# Detect smartDSU, which intercepts ACC_CMD from the DSU allowing openpilot to send it /

By deleting the "and candidate in TSS2_CAR" and testing, blind spot monitoring works during lane changes with my CH-R. 

Speaking with @mlp changing "TSS2_CAR" in that line to "NO_DSU_CAR" would include the no dsu cars, the additional check for the 0x3F6 fingerprint would disable BSM for cars that might be in the NO_DSU_CAR and TSS2_CAR  groups but do not have BSM, allowing for those that do to have BSM.

Device/Version information (please complete the following information):

Device: comma two
Dongle ID: [2876aae3c6df4380
Route: N/A
Timestamp: N/A
Version: 0.8.5
Car make/model: 2019 Toyota CH-R XLE

title: GM: steering faults
body:
While driving, a "Steering Temporarily Unavailable" error will display and the Comma Two will no longer engage.
It also show a "Cruise Fault" error.

Comma Two
Dongle ID:  e38a02cae1ef1e0c
Route:  e38a02cae1ef1e0c|2021-07-11--18-54-39 at 19:03:43
Route:  e38a02cae1ef1e0c|2021-07-11--19-05-29 at 19:12:59
Timestamp:  The error came at the end of the first route at 19:03:43 and pulled into a parking lot and reset the vehicle and there was another error at 19:12:59 at the end of the second route. 
They are from one trip, where I had to reset the vehicle and Comma after the first error.
Version:  Comma.ai Master .0.8.6
GMC Acadia 2018

If you pull over and turn off the vehicle and allow the vehicle and Comma device to reset, approximately three minutes, you can restart the vehicle and reengage OpenPilot.

My understanding is that this is a LKA timing issue and has been on-going on multiple GM vehicles. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is information that I received from someone else about this issue.

The issue only occurs when a lane keep assist message is sent less than 20 milliseconds after the one before it
My theory:  The code currently has a buffer that contains only the last Lane Keep Assist message it does not have a queue. 
 Another part of the software pulls this buffer close to exactly every 20 milliseconds.  Should two messages arrive within a 20 millisecond period, the earlier message is probably replaced by the newer one before the steering column had a chance to read it
So there's kind of two ways to fix this. Tighten up the timing - which is what the code currently does by moving the message generation onto the panda and using a timer on the panda.
The other option would be to simply skip three messages until you were back at the correct counter value.
Three messages is only 60 milliseconds
Nobody's going to notice a darn thing the car or you.

title: Zygote restart due to phone services crashing
body:
**Describe the bug**

While OP was driving on road, I got a red screen saying that there was an issue communicating between processes. OP continued to navigate for a couple more seconds before disengaging itself. I was able to immediately re-engage a few seconds later. After driving for a bit longer, the image on my C2 rotated upside down, however all seemed to keep working. A few more seconds later, the image froze entirely and the C2 became totally unresponsive, with no visual or auditory prompts. OP would still silently engage drive the car, however when cruise control was engaged. After a few minutes of driving, the image flashed and started working again and a few seconds later rotated back into the normal position.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Just drove for a few hours. Not sure how reproducible it is.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: a8149c07cf2713da
 - Route: a8149c07cf2713da|2021-07-09--21-59-15--86
 - Timestamp: Red screen at approximately 23:26:02, Image flipped at approximately 23:32:45, interface froze at approximately 23:33:35, interface unfroze and rotated back to normal at approximately 23:41:35
 - Version: master-ci fa9f92a7ce98605ec1c373b39bd72c4a268e7239
 - Car make/model: 2019 Manual Golf R

**Additional context**

The next drive the C2 complained about GPS reception. Not sure if this is related or not, as the C2 was not rebooted between uhhh drives.

Let me know if any extra info is needed or if there is any tested you'd like me to do. ;)

title: Palisade Problems
body: Hello everyone.  I'm new to openpilot and currently having some bugs/issues with my 2021 Hyundai Palisade SEL convenience and premium HDA package.  Whenever I have the cruise set, and come into a stop/go situation the openpilot software still holds the scenario and never enters the "stop and go press pedal to continue screen".  On top of this inconvenience the cluster screen will flash, and all the SES lights will momentarily flash including the transmission selection GUI.  This flashing in the cluster will continue, sometimes several times until the car in front of me pulls away.  Whenever the car pulls away the openpilot will continue to follow the car without any driver inputs.  I did a little bit of hardwire debugging myself and it seems that the harness and all the connections are intact and properly connected to the car.  Any ideas what this may be?  Ill add the datalog tomorrow with the instructions pasted below on my drive to work.  I think this is an excellent community with a great accomplishments, but this glitch is driving me crazy! Anyone have similar issues? Thanks.

title: Regenerated segments do not have openpilot engaged
body: The state is not initialized, and openpilot never becomes enabled in these segments. So controlsd and parts of the planner are never tested.
