title: 2019 Kia Niro PHEV - No steering under 32 MPH
body:
**Describe the bug**: When system is active (ACC turned on) if the driving speed (not the set speed) goes below 32 MPH, the steering control will disengage with out warning. When driving under 32 MPH then moving the set speed from 29 to 32 MHP, the system can violently (quickly turning right or left) as the system assumes control as the car transitions from 31 to 32 MPH. This can be quite alarming and renders the system unsafe under those operations. Rolling the set speed from above 32 MPH to below 32 results in a benign disengagement of the steering (i.e. just stops controlling the steering but doesn’t do so in a erratic behavior). This behavior makes the system not usable under 32 MPH and dangerous in freeway stop-n-go traffic. 

I’ve tried both Circuit-pro fork “hkg_085” and Donfyffe, also with v0.8.5, and both have the same 32 MPH issue described above.

**How to reproduce or log data**: As stated above. 

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**: I would like the system to control the steering wheel once ACC is set in the car and allow the car’s steering wheel to be controlled from 0 MPH, there by allowing the software to function in stop-n-go traffic. At the very least there should be a warning to NOT use the system in stop-n-go traffic especially if the car speeds bounces above and below 32 MPH. It would also be nice to have something on the C2 display showing when C2 is actively controlling the steering wheel. 

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: cd5179e1
 - Route: ?? Not using comma services so my.comma.ai/useradmin is blank
 - Panda FW: 46fda13fee69be84
 - Timestamp: Anytime the conditions are ACC engaged and speed is set below 32 MPH
 - Version: v0.8.5 from “Circuit-Pro” branch “hkg_085”
 - Car make/model: Kia Niro Plug-in Hybrid 2019

**Additional context**

title: Lexus UX has heavy wobble with Corolla tuning parameters
body:
Previously submitted pull request for Lexus UX, and in the latest release the tuning uses the same as the Corolla Hybrid instead of submitted parameters.
Requesting to use different tuning parameters for the UX compared to Corolla parameters

title: paramsd: sanity checks triggered while driving at constant speed
body:
Experienced numerous disengagements, red screen and alarm regarding vehicle parameters, after ~3 hours of constant driving.  Once started, repeated at random intervals of ~1-10 minutes.  Stopped after unplugging the Comma-2, and plugging it back in (turned it off and on again).  Errors started again after another ~3 hours.  This repeated a few days later on the return trip as well.

A few other users noted similar issues in the Facebook group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/706398630066928).  Different car models seemed to be involved, but Comma-2 with 0.8.5 was consistent.

title: Driver monitoring false positives since 0.8.5
body:
**After updating my Comma 2 to OP v0.8.5 and attempting several drives I have noticed a drastic increase in faults and warnings for Driver Monitoring. While driving the same vehicle, in the same programmed seating position, with the same eyewear I have worn for years, OP proceeded to give me DM faults every 5-10 seconds when seated in the normal position. In an attempt to provide some on the spot "Gemba Testing", I tried removing my glasses, this would stop the faults from occurring. I then tried with my glasses on, as usual, leaning forward extremely close to the steering wheel and the Comma 2, which seemed to mitigate the faults as well. Again, I am not sure if this was an intended change or not, but it has made the Comma 2 unusable for me as the driving position and/or not wearing my glasses would be both unsafe and uncomfortable, thus not making my driving chill.**

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma 2
 - Dongle ID: d952837313c3e269
 - Route: No routes showing in web interface for some reason
 - Timestamp: The duration of the last drive on June 19th, 2021 where OP was engaged
 - Version: 0.8.5
 - Car make/model: Honda Pilot 2020

title: Since v0.8.5, OP no longer keeps breaking when cruise disengages on Honda
body:
**Describe the bug**

Prior to v0.8.5, if OP was breaking when cruise disengages, it would continue to brake behind the lead car all the way to 0mph.  Since v.0.8.5, it doesn't do that anymore.  It just disengages cruise and lets go of the brake.  The first time it happened it caught me off-guard because I was on a downhill and it sped up towards the car in front of me.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Get behind someone who slows from >22mph to <22mph while OP is engaged.

**Expected behavior**

I would expect the pre-0.8.5 behavior of continuing to break down to 0mph.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 0c769fcdc1652c86
 - Route: 0c769fcdc1652c86|2021-06-20--21-22-53
 - Timestamp: 1 min 15 seconds into drive (22:24:08)
 - Version: 0.8.5
 - Car make/model: 2018 Honda Odyssey 

**Additional context**

I'm new to OP and filing issues, so please let me know if I did anything wrong. The timestamp above is another incident I captured, not the original downhill incident.

title: hyundai: inconsistent fingerprinting
body:
sonata and palisade (perhaps others?) will sometimes fuzzy fingerprint even though no ecus have had a firmware update

example route: 24804955a125718c|2021-06-13--15-31-24

I see what happened is we query a few data ids and it does not get a response for data id \xf1\xa0 (normally I guess it does).  It looks like there are many cases where we have the same ecu fw versions for a vehicle with and without \xf1\xa0  at the end, and other ecus never return a value for this data id.  I also see the data returned by this id is pretty much always included in another id that is being queried.

Since you cannot run a script and capture all combinations easily we could
* drop \xf1\xa0 id from the query list
* retry fingerprinting a few times

title: Hugging Center Line, Changing between 2019 Camry and 2019 RDX
body:
I purchased the Comma 2 less than 3 months ago.  I started running it in my 2019 Camry, which worked fine.
      I was told by support at Comma.ai, that I could move the OP between 2 vehicles. 

My son added the signature for the 2019 RDX.  
  (brtk on discord, he is a hell of a lot better programmer than I am, I was a software test engineer in a past life)  
   The 2019 RDX is now supported in the  v0.8.4-release, which I recently loaded.

The problem basically is that when I started driving the Camry down the road today (after moving the device from the RDX), the car will hug the center line, almost on top of it.   In the "Line" mode, the lines that should indicate what the OP is finding for the outside lines of the lanes, are no longer indicating the road edges, but rather track inside the road lines in a closing inverted "V" formation.

I "suspect" that this may have been caused when I moved the OP (Comma 2) from the 2019 Camry SE to the 2019 RDX Tech Pkg.

This same problems has occurred twice now.  The first time when I was running the GIT branch that my son created.  The second time was today.  My wife had driven the RDX on a 450 mile trip this last weekend and returned.  I then moved the OP back to the Camry this morning and discovered that the problem had in fact, occurred for the 2nd time.   

The first time this happened was on about 6/3/21 but I was running the GIT branch that my son created.  I consequently reloaded the v0.8.4-release code.

I tried contacting support@comma.ai after the first incident but they only asked questions, and suggested that I enter a bug report.

I'm not certain yet on exactly how to reproduce the behavior, other than the swap the OP between the two cars a few times.  

I'm hoping that someone can explain this erratic behavior 
   I do have a couple pictures that I took with my phone showing the "V" lines in the road ahead.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma 2
 - Dongle ID: 6dce577e927e86b3
 - Route: I can't get the route number because with my OP here in the house, my OP appears Off-Line
 -         I don't understand why there are no drives showing!!!!
 - Timestamp: I don't have the exact "timestamp" but it was at about 10:00 AM 6/16/21.
 - Version: v0.8.4-release
 - 2019 Toyota Camry (was removed from the 2019 Acura RDX

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

please contact me at **mcfroston@gmail.com**

![OP, Hugging Center Line, 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44126744/122142977-14e3ae00-ce16-11eb-82ec-2c9ed3455dee.jpg)

title: OP accelerated while the lead car was stopped
body:
**Describe the bug**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The lead car in front was stopped and the OP braked properly. However, after sometime it just accelerated for no reason resulting me manually taking over

**How to reproduce or log data**
N/A
<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->
N/A

title: Meta: Community Wiki Changes Immediate
body:
I recently modified the community wiki page https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/wiki/SSH and the changes were live immediately with no approval process (see the [history](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/wiki/SSH/_history) for [my change](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/wiki/SSH/_compare/d87660be1885cdfa8bd9922d38e476899a3d4fb4...754b77091e9b36acbac4f46349269c9107992ed7)). I'm not even certain anyone is notified that changes have been made. Can I have someone peer review the changes I've made? (I added the Experienced Developer Quick Start)

This behavior may be intentional, but I looked for anything discussing this and couldn't find it. I'm opening this report since the policy could be abused by spam bots.

Best of memory, when I've made similar changes in other projects it generated a pull request to the wiki directly in browser. Perhaps my mind has fabricated this memory though.

title: offroad settings: buttons not disabled if started with ignition on
body:
**Describe the bug**
After a fresh boot, you can access the buttons in the device menu while OP is on road and engaged.
Accessing the preview of the driver monitoring camera will cause OP to disengage unexpectedly and for an LKAS fault to appear on screen in OpenPilot. After this, the items in the device menu will be greyed out, and inaccessible. You will be able to engage OP again after a few seconds.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Start with a C2 that is powered off. Let it boot up, and then start driving. Engage OP, click on the gear button, and select the driver monitoring preview button while OP is engaged. OP will disengage unexpectedly and display an LKAS error.

**Expected behavior**

The buttons in the device menu should always be inaccessible when on road.

title: VW MQB: Can't initiate auto lane change with comfort turn signal
body:
**Describe the bug**

The VW port is using the instantaneous state of the turn signal stalk switch to feed `CarState.[left|right]Blinker`. Apparently other ports are setting the blinker state True for the entire duration of automated comfort blinking.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Touch the turn stalk momentarily, and openpilot is only momentarily willing to enter an auto lane change state.

**Expected behavior**

It would seem (#21130) the expectation is for openpilot to allow auto lane change entry during the comfort blink period, a few seconds after a momentary touch of the turn signal stalk.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Dongle ID: 7aae592fc08e895f
 - Route: 7aae592fc08e895f|2021-06-04--22-46-03
 - Timestamp: tested 536 seconds into the drive
 - Version: current-ish master with other car port/tuning tweaks
 - Car make/model: 2018 Volkswagen Golf R

title: 2020 Ioniq PHEV Support
body:
Accompanying PRs: https://github.com/commaai/panda/pull/655, https://github.com/commaai/opendbc/pull/401

No behavior change, sets up support for Hyundai HEVs using the different gas pedal signal.

This new signal is needed and works on:
- 2020 Ioniq PHEV Limited
- 2021 Sonata Hybrid
- 2018 Kia Niro Hybrid

Note: Accel_Pedal_Pos is speed on the above cars

New signal is absent from:
- 2020 Ioniq Electric
- 2020 Kia Niro EV
- 2019 Kona Electric
- 2017 Kia Optima Hybrid (it's non-zero, but doesn't catch all gas presses)

title: Changing lanes then changing back causes lane change assist to continue trying to change lanes in the previous direction.
body:
**Describe the bug**

Signaling and using lane change assist to change lanes back and fourth in rapid succession, like when passing a parked car, causes lane change assist to continue trying to change lanes in the first direction signaled, and will fight you on the change back to the original lane.

For example: You're in the right lane and there is a parked car in front, you signal and change left to pass the parked car with lane change assist, then immediately signal right again before lane change assist completes. After lane change assist completes the left lane change, it will think you're signaling and trying to make another left lane change despite signaling right. OP will fight you during the entirety of the right lane change.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Signal and change lanes in one direction, then immediately signal in the opposite direction while the initial lane change is still completing. After the initial lane change completes, OP will think that you're trying to make a second lane change in the same direction, instead of back to your previous lane as you've signaled.

**Expected behavior**

For lane change assist to realize that the direction signaled has changed.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma2
 - Dongle ID: 903210ecc0cb706b
 - Route: 903210ecc0cb706b|2021-06-02--23-18-38--11
 - Timestamp: 23:30:00
 - Version: 0.8.4
 - Car make/model: VW Golf R Manual

**Additional context**

IIRC, if you turn your signal off, and then re-trigger it will "fix" the problem, however if you re-trigger your signal in a different direction from the first one while lane change assist is working, it will not realize the direction has changed.

Talking to @jyoung8607, he thinks  it may have regressed in #20765

Let me know if you have more questions. :)

title: Red Alert (Steering Temp. Unavilable) on Winding Turns when Manually Steering
body:
**Issue**
Since 0.8.4, release-2 was installed on my C2, I am getting many red alerts stating "Take Control Immediately- Steering Temporarily Unavailable". Mostly getting the take control immediately red alerts when steering the car by hand in a winding corner, most at lower speed (0-35mph). Previous versions of OP (0.8.3 and below) would give me a yellow alert when engaged on the same winding turns. The old yellow alert would say "steering unavailable" or "steering torque maxed out" and would not go past that stage into a red alert. Whenever the yellow or red alert was happening, I was hand steering the vehicle. The new red alert on winding roads doesn't make much sense, especially since I am hand steering already. Also it feels as though OP still has EPS control when these red alerts are occurring. I feel like the excessive amount of red alerts directly related to this "Steering Temporarily Unavailable" is devaluing the importance of getting a red alert. The previous yellow worked well for getting attention when maxing out the EPS torque. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

Ideally find a winding road that supports a speed of 35mph or less (lesser the speed the more the red alert occurs). With OP engaged, start hand steering the vehicle through the winding turn and on an apex of a turn give the steering wheel a slight over correction. This red alert happens when not over correcting in turns as well, but it's the easiest way to make the issue occur. Another way to make the issue repeat is to be in stop and go traffic on a winding off ramp and make steering adjustments at low speed (20mph or less). Hand turning the steering wheel too much will cause the same red alert. 

**What you expected to happen**

Yellow alert to get driver to put hands on steering wheel. Yellow alert stating something like "Steering Unavailable" (if that's accurate), and "Take Control".

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 9945372986050f92
 - Route: 9945372986050f92|2021-05-27--10-19-25
 - Timestamp: 10 minutes into drive
 - Version: 0.8.4 release-2
 - Car make/model: Toyota Corolla Hatchback 2019

**Additional context**

I have additional drives on my daily C2 from driving in the city and this is when I first noticed the issue. Those drives will have more realistic driving. The route segment provided in this report was me trying to provoke the issue on a separate C2. 

![IMG_0416 - Copy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75038839/119857931-f9a21480-bee1-11eb-9de8-6d037ab9dc14.jpg)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75038839/119859734-a630c600-bee3-11eb-90d8-053d4fa1f934.mp4

title: My vehicle no longer works after updating
body:
**I upgraded to 0.8.4 and my Comma Two no longer works with my vehicle.**



I received my Comma Two in Aug 2020 and my 2018 GMC Acadia's fingerprint was slightly different from the already "Community Supported" Acadia that was added by CryptoKylan in version 0.5.7

I contacted Comma.ai and Virtually Chris McCammon created a new branch for me with my vehicle's fingerprint on Oct 14, 2020 (GMC-Acadia-fp) and when I tried to use that branch, I was getting constant "Steering Temporarily Unavailable" errors when trying to engage OpenPilot or seemingly at random while driving with OpenPilot.

The Community pointed me to JShuler because he had already solved the same bug for the Chevy Bolt port.

Jason was very helpful and created a branch for me on Oct 21, 2020 and I have been using it ever since.  https://github.com/JasonJShuler/openpilot/tree/devel-luckyguy

I was hoping that the fork/branch that I had been using for many months would have been upstreamed, but Jason Shuler was banned.

My Comma Two's Dongle ID is:  e38a02cae1ef1e0c

My vehicle is a 2018 GMC Acadia Denali w/ FE5 Suspension

I have uploaded a few drives for you to review.

This should be a route with radar data:  e38a02cae1ef1e0c|2021-05-26--07-47-02--0

I'm not a computer programmer, but I'm not totally illiterate. 

It seems like if someone would upstream the fork/branch that I've been using, maybe other compatible GM vehicles might benefit.

I copied it to my GitHub at:  https://github.com/Verylukyguy/openpilot

title: Deleter behavior not consistent for boot and crashlogs
body: The deleter looks at creation date of the folder. This doesn't work for the bootlogs and crashlogs, since the folder is created once but grows over time. When the deleter decides to wipe it, it removes the whole folder. These two folders need to be excluded from the folder logic, and needs be handled on a file-by-file basis by deleter.

title: manager.py there is a never equal if test
body:
**Describe the bug**

     if params.get("DongleId") == UNREGISTERED_DONGLE_ID:                                                                                                                                                     
        ignore += ["manage_athenad", "uploader"]
 
This `if` statement will never be executed.

It should be changed to :

     if params.get("DongleId", encoding='utf-8') == UNREGISTERED_DONGLE_ID:                                                                                                                                                     
        ignore += ["manage_athenad", "uploader"]

title: LTA suddenly unavailable CAN errors in very specific geographical area under construction seconds after OP disengagement.
body:
**Describe the bug**

LTA (Lane Tracing Assist) became unavailable when driving through specific construction area with complicated lane lines (due to construction). The LTA remains unavailable until the comma 2 device is rebooted. Once rebooted all is normal and OP works well. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

_Im not exactly sure here_. BUT this happened two times:

[The first time](https://my.comma.ai/cabana/?route=89cfb7df8e0479db%7C2021-05-21--17-17-50&exp=1653366374&sig=ciz3gw7oWrpbIT%2B3g0CiDdi5TC09ge5nls0l6IILOC4%3D&max=-1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fchffrprivate-vzn.azureedge.net%2Fchffrprivate3%2Fv2%2F89cfb7df8e0479db%2Faf1ef8e5ff8d9b4c32d3316bfa8cf976_2021-05-21--17-17-50) i was driving west bound on rt 80 through a construction area. I had experienced a mistake in the lane tracing and pushed the wheel to correct. _a few seconds later_ OP warns me to take control immediately and i see LTA errors on my hud. 



[The second time](https://my.comma.ai/cabana/?route=89cfb7df8e0479db%7C2021-05-23--18-38-42&exp=1653366306&sig=HKOkWletllxTN0%2BJeYyVoFvVXxA2dD3sEFVeaNsBD5Q%3D&max=-1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fchffrprivate-vzn.azureedge.net%2Fchffrprivate3%2Fv2%2F89cfb7df8e0479db%2Fcf7b92618243cf67bd5e53a621bc03f7_2021-05-23--18-38-42) i was driving east bound on rt 80 through the same construction area. This time i disengaged OP to drive through myself. Very shortly after disengagement, that same error happened again. 


**Expected behavior**

Im not exactly sure here either beyond just normal operation & no error thrown at my CAN bus

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma Two
 - Dongle ID: 89cfb7df8e0479db
 - Route: 
        1. ) 89cfb7df8e0479db|2021-05-21--17-17-50
        2. ) 89cfb7df8e0479db|2021-05-23--18-38-42
 - Timestamp: Final minute of video (rebooted both times & ended video)
 - Version: 0.8.4
 - Car make/model: 2021 Toyota RAV4 XLE

**Additional context**

I believe both of these technically happened when i took control, either by manually adjusting the steering or disengaging via break/gas. For some reason i cannot see the CAN log data even though i have the raw data upload enabled. Open pilot works perfectly literally everywhere else ive used it.

title: Prevent NaNs from propagating
body:
In https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/issues/20798 NaNs from locationd propagated all the way down to controls causing undefined controls outputs. This needs be detected and recovered from at every layer

Locationd
- [x] Reset filter and log when NaNs are detected

Paramsd
- [x] Check for NaNs in measurements and ignore
- [x] Check for NaNs in kalman filter output, reset and log

Controlsd
- [ ] Add check before carController to prevent NaNs from sending undefined control outputs to the car

title: 2020 Corolla isn't fingerprinting all the required ECUs (only getting esp eps and camera)
body:
**Describe the bug**

Corolla isn't fingerprinting all the required ECUs. It is only getting esp eps and camera. (see Comma Support ticket #12479)

**How to reproduce or log data**

Turn on car with _new_ Comma 2 unit (see additional context below with why _new_ unit). When car is turned on, Comma turns on like normal and goes through boot sequence but car throws LTA errors, Cruise Errors. When unplugging comma and plugging back in stock connectors, errors go away.

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->
Plug in Comma unit instead of stock and use it to drive.

Reproduce errors with Comma, and no errors with Stock
https://photos.app.goo.gl/rZY9tJaRH2a3jhmCA

Specific Errors: 
https://photos.app.goo.gl/yK7B8apy6j2ciVyWA

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: c0f760f08b83b7ba
 - Timestamp: Startup
 - Version: 9a0006fa0a / release 2 / v0.8.3
 - Car make/model: 2020 Toyota Corolla | VIN: 5YFS4RCE1LP047069

**Additional context**

Support team at Comma replaced my Comma 2 unit, not harness. Here was original ticket opened:

> I ordered my comma last march, 7683.
> 
> Its been working well in a 2020 Corolla but this past week, as I got into my car I saw something about an upgrade, Neo I think?
> 
> I let the upgrade finish and all went well. I drove twice that day with no issues.
> 
> Two days ago, I was driving when all of a sudden I received a light saying "Malfunction with cruise control" or something to that effect from the Corolla; don't quote me on exact language. I noticed that the comma restarted, mid-driving. Once it turned back on and I power cycled the car, it worked again as normal. This was about 10 minutes into a drive and it definitely wasn't hot outside, 40s, 50s maybe? Unsure what caused a reboot only 10m in.
> 
> Then later that day (about 60m after the reboot incident), I went to drive and the Comma2 won't turn on at all. No display. It looks like it has no power.
> 
> After browsing all of github issues, I can't seem to find anything about the comma not powering up at all. I did however learn there was a small light on the back near the power cord.
> 
> When power is plugged in but the car isn't on, I get a flashing blue light on the back. When the car is on, it changes to solid blue. However the display of the comma is off, nothing is happening still. The unit looks dead other than this light.
> 
> I've tried to hold power, hold power + volume up, power + volume down... Nothing. I of course pulled the power plug from the back of the unit dozens of times now. Pulled power and let it sit with no power all night. Tried to power again today, nothing. And when I saw power, I've always used the car so I've ruled out problems with amperage, right cord, etc from inside. (However, I can power with 2.4a Usb-a to usb-c outside of the car, I just get the blue blinking light similar to when plugged in within the car, with the car off.
> 
> I haven't done anything different in months, it's been working flawlessly. The only thing I can point to is that upgrade on Wednesday of this past week.

title: Chrysler Pacifica 2017: LKAS fault when disengaging
body:
Describe the bug
 When OpenPilot is engaged and the vehicle stops for traffic, OpenPilot sometimes fails to start driving from a stopped position, and the following error occurs: "LKAS fault: Restart car to engage". The following steps will always result in this fault, but there are other various situations where a LKAS fault occurs.

 Vehicle: Chrysler Pacifica 2017 (Non-Hybrid)
 LKAS threshold: 9 m/h

How to reproduce or log data
1.Power up OpenPilot (OP)
2.Allow OP to come to a stop behind another vehicle.
3.Wait in a stopped position for an extended period of time (approximately 30 or more seconds).
4.OP will not move the vehicle forward once traffic begins moving.
5.Press gas pedal to move the vehicle forward.
6.LKAS error "LKAS fault: Restart car to engage" will appear on the OP screen.
7.The car will indicate that the LKAS system is unavailable.
8.OP functionality is unavailable.

Expected behavior
 OP should be able to engage and re-engage driving when the vehicle comes to a stop in traffic. This functionality of OP works without causing an LKAS fault when the vehicle only stops momentarily/very brief stops.

Device/Version information (please complete the following information):
•Device: Comma Two
•Dongle ID: 410c721d6d35265f

•Route: 410c721d6d35265f|2021-04-21--12-35-12--5
•Timestamp: Just After ~12:40
&
•Route: 410c721d6d35265f|2021-04-21--12-22-18--5
•Timestamp: Just After ~12:27

•OP/Device Version & Firmware:
 openpilot v0.8.3-release
 Git branch: release2
 Git Commit: 9a0006fa0a 
 Panda Firmware: 18cd8199fe2184f3
 OS Version: NEOS 16.2
•Car make/model: Chrysler Pacifica 2017


Additional context
The fixes to the previous Pacifica 2020+ LKAS issue (https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/issues/2110#issuecomment-824297336) seems to have fixed some of the LKAS issues for the 2017+ Pacifica (LKAS faults occur in fewer situations while driving), but the above steps still cause LKAS faults in the 2017+.

title: Locationd uses blocking params.put()
body: Locationd uses a blocking call to params.put() to write the last gps position. This could block the whole thread, potentially leading to a communication issue alert.

body:

I took over immediately and disengaged OP, but was able to immediately reengage OP both times.

title: Communication Error Between Processes
body:
**Describe the bug**

Communication error appears after approximately 5 minutes into drive. Bug occured today after merging my tuning fork (hehe) with new commits to master.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Go for a drive, engage OP, wait for communication error. I have gotten this error 5 times already, through reboots, and resetting the local repository (and updating submodules).

**Expected behavior**

No communication error.

**Device/Version information**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: c75a59efa0ecd502
 - First occurrence: c75a59efa0ecd502|2021-04-06--10-59-12 at 11:06:52
 - Occurs twice in this segment: c75a59efa0ecd502|2021-04-06--11-14-42 at 11:20:53 and 11:23:21
 - Version: https://github.com/speedking456/openpilot - master branch @ e0219c1
 - Car make/model: Kia Seltos 2021

I would have run commaai/master to try it, but my fork apart from tuning has no differences. Also only broke after a pull request from commaai/master, so definitely not my scuffed coding ability.

Created a new branch master-fix removing the merge. It does not have the issue. Drive with that branch: c75a59efa0ecd502|2021-04-06--15-10-18 error did not occur and OP functioned as expected.

Master on my branch has the commits that cause the error.

title: Car fw versions in useradmin don't have proper formatting
body:
Before 0.8.3, carfw was shown in the same format as it is in the values.py file.

Since many people still use useradmin to fingerprint their cars, we should make the logs match what they would see in values.py to prevent PRs [like this](https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/20583)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37757984/113651090-366e2f80-9646-11eb-9a56-20cdd0320462.png)

title: Connect Offline while connected to wifi
body:
**Describe the bug**

 About a week ago my comma2 started saying "Connect Offline" even when connected to wifi.  Today when turning it on to upgrade to 0.8.3.  It gave me a red time / date cannot be updated error and then a "Openpilot will stop engaging in 0 days" error.  I sshed into the comma and deleted and cloned release2, which all worked fine because it was connected to wifi.  Upgrade went smoothly, including the neos upgrade, and when it turns on it first says "Connect Online" but changes to "Connect Offline" after 1 second.  Multiple reboots produce the same issue.  This is the case whether connected to the vehicle or just a usb power supply.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Connect to wifi, observe it says Connect Offline.  
Let me know if there are any logs I can share please.

I expect it to say Connect Offline so it won't eventually refuse to enable and get updates.

title: Updated never runs if thermald crashes on start
body: If thermald crashes on start `IsOffroad` will never be set causing updated to never run.

title: When the lead car creeped ahead, OP failed to stop
body:
**Describe the bug**
I was behind a lead car. OP stopped as expected for the lead but as soon the lead car creeped a head, it almost tried to crash in to the lead car.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
I was driving on the stock OP. Usually OP never has a problem in stopping for a lead car. But this one time, OP stopped for the lead car and then as soon as the lead car creeped ahead, OP tried to accelerate abruptly and was about to crash in to the car. I had to manually take over and put the brakes on the car. If I were to not do anything this would have definitely resulted in a bad accident. 

**How to reproduce or log data**
I have only seen this bug happen once. So I can't reproduce it.

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->
N/A

**Expected behavior**
When the lead car creeps ahead, OP shouldn't accelerate abruptly and should stop for the lead car.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

title: Freeway lane marking tracking
body:
**Describe the bug**
Good evening. I'm reporting a comma lane marking tracking problem. Before version .82
My comma would track freeway lane marking and center vehicle with minimal left or right corrections. Now. The tracking markers are (inside) the actual freeway marking. Causing the vehicle to drift back and forth inside the actual freeway marking. The vehicle is either to far left or right and occasionally making contact with the roadway bumps and on gentle curves. I manually hold the wheel to prevent oversteer.
Any help to correct this problem would be greatly appreciated.
Toyota Rav4 2018 Hybrid 
Fred Batin.

title: Torque and steering angle rate values wrong for some cars
body:
Ideally we would get from every car:
- Steering angle in degrees
- Steering angle rate in degrees/sec
- Human torque (torque human exerts on steering wheel) in NM
- EPS torque (the torque added by the EPS on the steering wheel) in NM

Human torque and steering angle are used in openpilot, so I assume those are correct. The other two seem to be wrong on many cars. I looked at some data to find the cars on which they are wrong, this isn't necessarily complete, but should give good picture. 


### Steering angle rate problems
**Sign flipped on these cars**
- [x] HONDA ODYSSEY 2018 EX-L 
- [x] HONDA FIT 2018 EX 
- [x] HONDA RIDGELINE 2017 BLACK EDITION
- [x] HONDA CR-V 2016 TOURING
- [x] HONDA PILOT 2017 TOURING
- [x] HONDA PILOT 2019 ELITE
- [x] HONDA HRV 2019 TOURING
- [x] ACURA ILX 2016 ACURAWATCH PLUS

**Strictly positive on these cars**

- [ ] HYUNDAI SONATA 2019
- [ ] KIA NIRO EV 2020

**Not set on these cars**

- [ ] SUBARU IMPREZA LIMITED 2019

- [ ] NISSAN ROGUE 2019
- [ ] NISSAN LEAF 2018
- [ ] NISSAN X-TRAIL 2017
- [ ] SUBARU OUTBACK 2015 - 2017

### EPS Torque problems
**Strictly positive on these cars**

- [ ] HONDA FIT 2018 EX 
- [ ] HONDA ACCORD 2018 LX 1.5T

- [x] SUBARU IMPREZA LIMITED 2019

title: LKA error / sudden loss of lateral control and device hard rebooting
body:
**Description**

Was driving and the the vehicle unexpectedly veered out of the lane during a highway curve (in the overtaking/left lane).

Speed was steady but the lateral control went out, followed by an 'LKA error', then followed by the Comma hanging and rebooting (at this point the car displayed a 'Cruise Control Malfunction' error). When I stopped, turned off the car and rebooted the device and it was fine afterwards.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Unable to reproduce immediately under same external conditions. Data was synced via explorer. There are before and after video segments with a few seconds showing all trace lines disappearing from the OP Comma display prior to veering out of lane.

**Expected behavior**

Maintaining lateral control (and ideally warning of a loss from the device; only the stock warning chimed).

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma2
 - Dongle ID: 74fc73caf41697fa
 - Route: Wed, Feb 24 @ 06:49 to 10:12
 - Timestamp: Approximately at 10:11 (with post-device-reboot video in following segments)
 - Version: OpenPilot v0.8.1
 - Car make/model: 2021 Toyota Rav4

**Additional context**

My thoughts - it was a bit mucky (snow/slush mist); might have been the radar that threw a code (from being covered in dust). I wiped down the logo where the radar is housed and it didn't seem to happen again. Could also have been the (Toyota LKA) camera. Weather was fair with direct sun from driver's side. Prior to using OP, some highway drives would result in the Toyota throwing an error when the radar/camera would get obstructed by ice/dirt. Could be a possible link.

title: light_sensor value sticking
body:
**Describe the bug**

The brightness on my device is not adapting consistently when covering the light sensor with my thumb during the day or shining a light at it during the night.  I noticed at night when I shine a light at the light sensor then move it away that the value for s->light_sensor is getting stuck at a high value and not returning to 0 in the dark.  To get it to move to 0 I need to keep moving my light over the sensor to trigger the sensor events.  My C2 is very dim during the day so I was trying to adjust the  BRIGHTNESS_M value so I can see it during the day.

in ui.cc:
float clipped_brightness = fmin(512, (s->light_sensor*brightness_m) + brightness_b);
smooth_brightness = fmin(255, clipped_brightness * 0.01 + smooth_brightness * 0.99);
ui_set_brightness(s, (int)smooth_brightness);

**How to reproduce or log data**

In a dark room, shine cell phone light at the light sensor
In a bright room, cover the cell phone light sensor with your thumb

check the value of s->light_sensor

**Expected behavior**

the brightness of the screen should adapt to the environment

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Version: 0.8.1-release

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

title: TSS2 Corolla needs angle offset for more accurate angle signal from torque message
body:
This line seems to be incorrect along with the comment for a TSS2 Corolla: https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/master/selfdrive/car/toyota/carstate.py#L22. I'm just not sure if the TSS2 Corolla is the exception or if we can always offset if that more accurate angle is seen and just remove the needs_offset variable. I think it's the latter and we can always offset if the angle signal in the torque message is available.

On birdman's TSS2 Corolla that `STEER_TORQUE_SENSOR` `STEER_ANGLE` signal that's being used always seems to start at 0, so the angle openpilot uses can have an offset that varies wildly between drives depending on where the wheel starts, since it's not being offset when it should.

This is simulating what carstate does now (but doesn't actually offset it, so you can see the difference in angles. It should have been offset -2.95829... degrees.
![Screenshot_164](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25857203/108022080-7ec58580-6fe5-11eb-9a23-5999a98ad34f.png)

Here's also the different angles plotted against each other:
![Screenshot_163](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25857203/108022298-eaa7ee00-6fe5-11eb-9842-eba8ea81b336.png)

From carstate is what openpilot uses, and from can is the message available and used on TSS1 cars that's not as precise (`STEER_ANGLE_SENSOR`, `STEER_ANGLE`).

title: SCons build fails with missing module compilation_db
body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to build  openpilot using `scons` in the home directory of  openpilot, it fails with the following error message: 

SConsEnvironmentError: No module named compilation_db:
  File ".../openpilot/SConstruct", line 147:
    env = Environment(
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Environment.py", line 990:
    apply_tools(self, tools, toolpath)
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Environment.py", line 102:
    env.Tool(tool)
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Environment.py", line 1809:
    tool = SCons.Tool.Tool(tool, toolpath, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Tool/__init__.py", line 122:
    module = self._tool_module()
  File "/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Tool/__init__.py", line 220:
    error_string = "No module named %s" % self.name


Looking in `/usr/lib/scons/SCons/Tool/__init__.py` where the eroor was thrown, it seems like scons is looking for the following file `./openpilot/site_scons/site_tools/compilation_db.py'`. In the `site_scons/site_tools` directory I only have `cython.py`. Is that expected? Am I missing some setup steps? 

Thanks for your help :slight_smile:

**How to reproduce**

```
cd $HOME/openpilot
scons -j$(nproc)
```
I tried running `ubuntu_setup.sh` script in the tools directory in case I was missing some dependencies and it did not help.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Build on Ubuntu 20.04LTS
 - Version: c189d15af9a613d8f109b39298c0ab3e22f39f6d on master branch

title: Alert message to immediately connect to the internet for updates even though OP is connected
body:
**Describe the bug**

After the drive, the OP started displaying the following message:

 "Immediately connect to the internet to check for updates. If you do not connect to the internet, openpilot won't engage in 1 day."

However, the OP is connected to the internet and uploads drives successfully.

title: Toyota Camry XLE switching from TSS to OP Longitudinal and back
body:
Running C2 in a Toyota Camry Hybrid XLE.  Tested Openpilot versions 0.7.10 - 0.8.1.
On fresh boot of the C2, Openpilot runs great, everything stable.  However, if I park the vehicle and turn off the engine for a short stop (to fill up on gas, buy coffee, etc), Once I start the engine (C2 wakes up) the following happens:

1. Openpilot displays an arrow on the screen pointing to the lead car
2. The car subtly accelerates and decelerates in quick cycles.  It sort of feels like I’m towing something. 
3. If lead car slows / stops, Openpilot is slow to see it and slow/stop.  I've had close calls where I've had to slam on brakes.
4. If I force reboot the C2, it resumes normal operation.  Everything is perfect again.
5. Alternatively, if I make a second short stop where I turn off the engine for a few minutes, when I turn the engine back on, the arrow indicating lead car is gone and all is normal

I've tried checking all connections, tried a new usb cable, and tried multiple versions 0.7.10 - 0.8.1.  

Dongle ID: e396297189f42a29
Car Make/Model: Toyota Camry Hybrid XLE 2018

title: Issues Resuming Speed at speed and from stop
body:
**Describe the bug**

The following issues are observed related to resuming selected speed:

1. Sometimes hen at a stop (after coming to a stop due to stopped car) OP will not resume.
2. Often When at speed (not from a stop) and the lead car slows down, OP will slow down but will not resume the selected speed. Instead it stays at the last constant speed or slowly decelerates (1mph/5seconds or so)
3. (possibly not related, harder to replicate) When going through and underpass, the car will slow down.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Add the `car bug` label for vehicle/brand specific bugs and the `bug` label for all other bugs. -->

**How to reproduce or log data**

For the issues above, reproduce as follows:
1. Allow lead car to stop while OP is engaged, and the the OP car will stop.
2. Allow the lead car to slow down. 
3. Drive through an underpass

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

for the issues above:
1-2 The car resumes speed as the lead car speeds up.
3. Speed remains unchanged.


<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

 - Device: FrEon
 - Dongle ID: ef51549c7112635e
 - Route: ef51549c7112635e|2021-01-15--16-50-17
 - Timestamp: ~10 minute into drive

DSU disconnected, no pedal. Black Panda.

title: PyJWT 2.0.0 does not return bytes for encode()
body:
calling `jwt.encode(...).decode('utf-8')` on pyjwt 2.0.0 and higher throws an error because `jwt.encode(...)` returns a `str` now instead of `bytes` (and Pipfile was updated to pyjwt 2.0.0)
https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/def24ae27ad4cd5948731770745d5039f20ffcf2/Pipfile.lock#L613-L620
if tests didn't catch this, we should probably add one!
https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/def24ae27ad4cd5948731770745d5039f20ffcf2/common/api/__init__.py#L30

title: UI: DM icon should accurately reflect DM policy
body: Currently, the DM icon only shows whether a face is detected, which is confusing in cases such as model uncertainty.

title: Toyota: fix EPS_STATUS message length
body: See #19692. @rav4kumar pointed out that EPS_STATUS is currently 5 bytes in the Avalon DBC, but the actual length is 8 bytes. I checked our Rav 4, and it has the same discrepancy. I suspect this is wrong for many or all Toyotas.

title: [2018 Nissan Leaf] Occasionally disengages when lead car brakes
body:
**Describe the bug**

Occasionally, when following a lead car, using the Nissan ProPilot stock cruise control doing logntiunal control and OpenPilot doing steering, when the lead car brakes, OpenPilot/ProPilot completely disengage with the seatbelt unplugged message shown on the HUD.

**How to reproduce or log data**

1. Have openpilot activated for steering, with Nissan stock system doing longitudinal control.
2. Have lead car indicated on HUD with set speed faster than lead car speed.
2. Lead car brakes.

**Expected behavior**

Leaf should brake along with lead car and stay engaged, as it does 9/10 times.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: e4d79cf6b8b19a0d
 - Route: e4d79cf6b8b19a0d|2021-03-01--18-30-59
 - Timestamps: 18:35:52, 18:45:45, 18:47:18 (may have happened other times on this drive, but these are the timestamps I am sure that it happened at).
 - Version: 0.8.2 (also happened with previous versions)
 - Car make/model: 2018 Nissan Leaf SV w/ tech package (ProPilot)

**Additional context**
It hasn't been happening recently (it seems like either it happened more during the warmer months OR happened more on pre-0.8 OpenPilot), but it happened at least 3x on this one drive.

I submitted a bug report about this several months ago but never responded with a route, apologies for that. I'll close that and link to this.

title: BSM Lane Change Fault
body:
**Describe the bug**

2021 RAV4. The Lane Change BSM has a fault scenario. This vehicle has a “BLINKING” lane change marker that may allow BSM to NOT override the Lane Change Assist, depending on instantaneous status of signal when turn signal is turned on. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

Activate lane change while OP is engaged. If a vehicle is present or approaching, the “blocked” message comes up on C2 Screen and OP prevents lane change. Once in awhile, the BSM Light on side-mirror appears to BLINK and vehicle starts lane change despite another vehicle being in blind spot. 

**Expected behavior**

The vehicles BSM status should prevent lane change, even when side-mirror indicator blinking a warning.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma Two
 - Dongle ID: e346693d5b95a02f
 - Route: https://my.comma.ai/cabana/?route=14b218baa26b0ebd%7C2020-12-30--19-08-07&exp=1640910369&sig=oFZ6%2FlxvNqUbhAA11InY9wxnRmifvAtBByv2byUqg%2Fs%3D&max=3&url=https%3A%2F%2Fchffrprivate-vzn.azureedge.net%2Fchffrprivate3%2Fv2%2F14b218baa26b0ebd%2Ffef299cdaf7f0f1d294776fff0d96974_2020-12-30--19-08-07

title: Haotic gas/brake comands Toyota Highlander 2019 -master-ci
body:
**Describe the bug**

When stopped in trafic the OP seems to have chaotic distance measurements from the stopped car in front, these leads to chaotic brake system engagements and disengaments which can be seen from specific noise of brake system, car micro movements, headlights darkening (from the power consumption of brake fluid pump)

Stop in traffic with OP engaged

**Expected behavior**

Some "smoothing" of distance data or gas/brake commands needed in the near zero speed modes.

 - Version: master-ci 12/21/2020
 - Car make/model: Toyota Highlander 2019 safety sense, derated to 249 hp

**Additional context**

Also at speed around 60 kmph with 8 mode automatic transmission same reason of unsmoothed gas commands lead to chaotic change of switching between 6,7,8 transmission mode (since the car cant understand if you are moving steadily in eco mode or trying to accelerate). Also some smoothing required.

title: Zygote restarting while OP active
body:
**Describe the bug**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Add the `car bug` label for vehicle/brand specific bugs and the `bug` label for all other bugs. -->

**How to reproduce or log data**

So for the past couple months, after a couple days of uptime, the comma two offroad UI will glitch out. The buttons respond with highlighting upon touch, but everything else stops working.

Starting the car correctly starts openpilot, and all works just fine, except the sound stops working completely (no disengage/engage sound).

A reboot solves the issue, until it eventually occurs again a few days later. Factory resets/reflashing have not fixed the issue, and I don't believe it to be a hardware fault.

---

This time, I left the comma two to bask in its glitched state and this ended up happening; the comma two had the spinning logo, while ALSO still driving my car. In the video below, I nudge the wheel to cause on purpose ping pong to prove it was still steering.

**Expected behavior**

The above behaviour should not occur. The UI should remain intact, and the device shouldn't "restart" while openpilot is active.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 4d70bc5e608678be
 - Route: 4d70bc5e608678be|2020-12-13--12-52-39--5 (When I can reproduce again, I will get logs... this route isn't helpful (adeeb looked at it).
 - Timestamp: N/A
 - Version: `master` based fork (basic additions like tuning), was rebased onto `1ea307a2996f16104501bf1d497e202326000dc1`
 - Car make/model: 2018 Subaru Impreza

title: Openpilot calibration stuck at 0% [Comma 2 / 2018 RAV4]
body:
**Describe the bug**

I purchased the comma 2 for my 2018 rav4 xle about 1 month ago. I am having issues getting it to calibrate. What is happening is that I will get the screen that says 'calibration 0% drive above 15mph' and then nothing happens. No errors and no changes in percent even after driving for 1hr. I have tried versions 0.7.9, 0.7.10, and 0.8.0 with community features both enabled and disabled for each version and I get the same results. I have tried unplugging everything and re-plugging. I've looked through the logs and it looks like almost everything under 'liveCalibration' is zero and does not update. The community says that the mounting looks good from the photos and dashcam recording I posted to discord. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

1. Start the car
2. Wait for calibration screen to display
3. Drive for a while but no change in percent or errors

Log Data: all 'liveCalibration' blocks appear to have the same values seen below.

> ( logMonoTime = 11086766343778,
  liveCalibration = (
    calStatus = 0,
    calCycle = 0,
    calPerc = 0,
    extrinsicMatrix = [0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 1.22, 1, 0, 0, 0],
    rpyCalib = [0, 0, 0],
    rpyCalibSpread = [0, 0, 0],
    validBlocks = 0 ),
  valid = true )


**Expected behavior**

I expect it to calibrate or display an error that it can not calibrate. 

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma 2
 - Dongle ID: 0feb5791ebfe2272
 - Route:  0feb5791ebfe2272|2020-12-09--17-11-23 [0.8.0], 	0feb5791ebfe2272|2020-11-06--15-40-51[0.7.9]
 - Timestamp: Entire drive. Anywhere after the first few minutes and I should be driving.
 - Version: I have tried versions 0.7.9, 0.7.10, and 0.8.0 with community features both enabled and disabled for each version
 - Car make/model: 2018 Toyota RAV4

title: adaptive cruise will be forcefully disengaged after 3 minutes of standstill on Toyota
body:
**Describe the bug**
With openpilot's current standstill, ACC will be forcefully disengaged by the car after exactly 3 minutes if the front car doesn't move. In this situation, the car will be shifted to park. This is a potential problem for comma pedal users as comma pedal users tend to not move the cruise control lever when the car is stopped, if the front car doesn't move due to heavy traffic, the car will be shifted to P

**How to reproduce or log data**
Stop behind a completely stationary car in a Toyota hybrid vehicle, after 3 minutes with no movements, ACC will be forcefully disengaged and the car shifted to P. 

**Expected behavior**
~~Enter the "Waiting" mode (seems to be related to `CRUISE_CONTROL_STATE` 11 in `PCM_CRUISE_SM`) instead of the current  "operate cruise lever or accelerator pedal to resume" mode.~~
openpilot issues a warning to let user take control before this occurs.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 399b1cca765e80b4
 - Route: 399b1cca765e80b4|2020-12-09--11-54-59
 - Timestamp: the final disengagement in this route
 - Version: 0.8.1
 - Car make/model: Toyota Prius 2018

**Additional context**
~~With openpilot's standstill logic, the car's dash will immediately display a "operate cruise lever or accelerator pedal to resume" message upon entering standstill, while the stock system will display the "waiting" message and only display "operate cruise lever or accelerator pedal to resume" after the front car has moved, which doesn't seem to trigger this lock-out.~~
okay waiting triggers this as well, so I am thinking openpilot can issue a warning on the screen after about 2 and a half minute so the user can push the lever manually to avoid this.

title: Comma2 does not startup after restarting car
body:
**Describe the bug**

I noticed this only on v0.8.0. My comma2 does not startup after restarting my car. I would need to unplug the usb-c cable and replug it back into my comma2 for it to start again. This happens only when I leave my car for a certain amount of time (unsure how long) but my C2 screen will go dark. When I restart my car in this state, my C2 will not startup. 

I tried turning off my car, waiting for the C2 to go dark and immediately turn on my car. At this moment, there is no issue, my C2 starts up. So I'm not sure how long I would need to leave my car. Both all of my experience is leaving my car for more than an hour. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

1. Power up C2 by plugging to the car.
2. Use C2 as normal.
3. End trip and turn off the engine. 
4. Leave the car for an amount of time (at least an hour).
5. Return to car and start the engine.
6. C2 will not start. Will need to unplug and replug the USB-C power cable. 

**Expected behavior**

C2 starts up when the car engine starts. This is expected since v 0.7.10.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma 2
 - Dongle ID: 7bc774bc8e17fd8a
 - Route: None because it is not captured
 - Timestamp: None because it is not captured
 - Version: v.8.0
 - Car make/model: Toyota Corolla 2019

title: C2 drains/kills Prius car battery (0.5-0.8) - likely not software related
body:
**Describe the bug**

Running 0.8 and my Prius Prime's 12V battery is dead again :D I don't drive the Prius but once a week or so. Considering the C2's blue light *always* flashes (edit, this may not be the case, but still), it doesn't seem that software is going to solve the battery drain issue. I've had 10+ dead battery events since having OP in my car; got stranded while out camping once, too. It's quite annoying and especially concerning now that it's winter.

**How to reproduce or log data**

Leave C2 installed in a vehicle with a smaller 12V battery, like a Prius/Prius Prime. Wait a week = dead battery.

**Expected behavior**

Not being stranded.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
Issue has been present for me since 0.5 across FrEON and C2

**Additional context**

The blue light flashes/is on the rear of the C2 even when the unit is turned off. Parasitic power drain is too high for those who don't drive their vehicles everyday and have smaller 12V batteries.

title: Lexus IS fails fingerprinting
body:
Lexus IS fails to be detected by open pilot

 `car bug`

** Reproduce bug **

Plug comma2 on master-ci branch. Car is not detected and runs in dashcam-only mode.

**Expected behavior**

We expect the car to be detected and OP to be available for engagement.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
- Device: comma2
- Dongle ID: 268f0090ec7ae6a7
- Route: 268f0090ec7ae6a7|2020-11-16--08-32-58
- Timestamp: 2020-11-16 8:32am EST
- Version: 0.8.0 master-ci branch
- Car make/model: 2018 Lexus IS 350 F Sport

**Additional context**

It appears the addition of the 2017 Lexus IS git commit (`dc819a3df138f3dc39f81489d5bd539901eaf960`)
has led to a regression.

I temporarily fixed the detection by removing the following: 

```
root@localhost:/data/openpilot$ git diff
diff --git a/selfdrive/car/toyota/values.py b/selfdrive/car/toyota/values.py
index a352fa08..1c054b41 100644
--- a/selfdrive/car/toyota/values.py
+++ b/selfdrive/car/toyota/values.py
@@ -748,13 +748,6 @@ FW_VERSIONS = {
       b'\x018966353R1100\x00\x00\x00\x00',
       b'\x018966353R8100\x00\x00\x00\x00',
     ],
-    (Ecu.engine, 0x7e0, None): [
-      b'\x02353P7000\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00530J5000\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00',
-    ],
-    (Ecu.esp, 0x7b0, None): [
-      b'F152653330\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00',
-      b'F152653301\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00',
-    ],
     (Ecu.dsu, 0x791, None): [
       b'881515306400\x00\x00\x00\x00',
       b'881515306500\x00\x00\x00\x00',
```


Also the Ecu.esp section does not show up consistently in the carFw output, so the car or OP needs to be restarted several times in order for OP to recognize the vehicle prior to this regression where the car is not detected at all.

See:  2020-11-15--20-10-20--0 (does not have ecu = esp) vs 2020-11-16--08-32-58--0 ( has ecu=esp)

```
    carFw = [
      ( ecu = esp,
        fwVersion = "F152653330\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00",
        address = 1968,
        subAddress = 0 ),
      ( ecu = dsu,
        fwVersion = "881515306400\x00\x00\x00\x00",
        address = 1937,
        subAddress = 0 ),

        fwVersion = "8965B53280\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00",
        address = 1953,
        subAddress = 0 ),
      ( ecu = engine,
        fwVersion = "\x018966353R1100\x00\x00\x00\x00",
        address = 1792,
        subAddress = 0 ),

        fwVersion = "8821F4702300\x00\x00\x00\x00",
        address = 1872,
        subAddress = 15 ),

title: 2018 Lexus IS 350 F Sport - mid drive CAN Error
body:
**OP Disengages mid-drive with CAN Error and loud beeping**

During an openpilot controlled drive, one of several failure scenarios occurs:

* OP shows CAN Error: check connections + loud triple beeping
* OP triple beeps then goes to status screen showing miles driven, comma points, etc.
* OP triple beeps, then reboots to being functional again
* OP triple beeps, then reboots to not recognizing vehicle.

**log data**

Reproduction steps is to drive a while, then failures occur.

2020-11-13 around 6:15p EST - triple beeped, then went to status screen. OP did not recognize car after restarting vehicle.

2020-11-14 around 1:24p EST - triple beeped, then went to status screen.

2020-11-14 around 3:36p EST - triple beeped, then displayed CAN Error: check connections.

**Expected behavior**

Doesn’t disengage and continues to operate.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma2
 - Dongle ID: 268f0090ec7ae6a7
 - Route: 268f0090ec7ae6a7|2020-11-14--15-21-15
 - Timestamp: 2020-11-14 3:36pm EST
 - Version: 0.8.0 master-ci branch
 - Car make/model: 2018 Lexus IS 350 F Sport

**Additional context**

* if it’s a hardware issue, bumpy roads seem to affect error rates a bit.
* seems to run well on smooth highways for 10-30 min stretches before failing
* replacement harness box seems less reliable than original harness box
* could be related to another user with a 2017 is350 where v1 fingerprinting works for him but v2 fingerprinting does not. Is it possible to lose fingerprinting mid-drive?

title: Comma 2 Manuel Power on will not work after 30 hour no drive inactivity
body:
**Describe the bug**  
  Comma 2 can not be manually powered on after Comma2 was automatically powered off when the 30 hours of no new drive inactivity period has lapsed.  Before version 0.7.10 and maybe 0.7.9, Comma 2 could be powered on and rebooted after this 30 hours and after not driving every day.  The time out period was to save car battery drain, as a hybrid its critical as the 12v start battery is not a powerhouse device. Now it does nothing, no buzz, blue light steady blinking from panda, using stock version 0.7.10 with the new neos.  No forks just a "plain Jane" setup and auto installs.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Add the `car bug` label for vehicle/brand specific bugs and the `bug` label for all other bugs. -->  
  The car will not boot using the manual power button after auto power off inactivity..  The only way to get it booted is to start the car, this starts a boot from scratch, not from the normal screen shown when ready and running.

**How to reproduce or log data**  ..................
   We need to test of a Comma 2 in a car setup and power supply, with a drive completed, Then park it  for 30 hours or until it indicates "appears offline" from the Comma Prime app.  Tapping the screen would open OP ready screen if its less then the 30 hours.  Using stock 0.7.10, no forks, and then attempt to start Comma2 manually with the power button when Comma2 indicates its fully powered off by the timer.
    It normally did power on and boot with a buzz. Now nothing and this would appears to be a software change or bug as its suppose to boot manually. I think the panda which is always running is not allowing it to boot due to a missing line of software.  Otherwise you need to start the car or it remains off line.   But because of the errors from the car it
![2020-11-05_15-41-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65055060/98314008-008b2900-1f8a-11eb-8ad1-3dae1b3adb43.jpg)
 need to be turned off then restarted



<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->  
  Time out the inactivity timer which has been said to be 30 hours of no drives or starting the car.  The Comma2 is installed and never removed and has been running for months and no cables are unplugged.  The device is not removed nightly as some users as I garage it.  So they might miss this bug as the reattaching Comma2 will open and boot automatically.

**Expected behavior**  After the 30 hours a push of the Comma 2 power button and Comma 2 did start a boot from power off.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->  As per a discussion with Discord and customer support, they also think it is suppose to boot up.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: [e.g. EON/EON Gold/comma two].... 
   Comma 2

 - Dongle ID: [e.g. 77611a1fac303767, can be found in Settings -> Device -> Dongle ID or my.comma.ai/useradmin]
   e4a16227cff292b5

 - Route: [e.g. 77611a1fac303767|2020-05-11--16-37-07, can be found in my.comma.ai/useradmin]
   after any driver, after a 30 hours of no drive which turn Comma2 off.

 - Timestamp: [When in the route the bug occurs (e.g. 4min 30s into the drive)]
    Any time after 30 hours and  power off of Comma2.
    
 - Version: [commit hash when on a non-release branch, or version number when on devel or release2 (e.g. 0.7.6)]
    possibly started in version 0.7.9 as I drove daily, but this version 0.7.10 with days of no driving, no forks, auto updated by your pushes.  Its worked since I got the device without any problems.  As for operation, Comma2 works as advertised and never had any cable problems or needed to insert them to solve any problems.

 - Car make/model: [e.g. Toyota Prius 2016]
   2020 Prius Prime XLE, un plugged DSU and in version 0.7.9 was when I started to try the unplugged DSU driving.  Unplugged DSU allows full Openpilot and the long (Speed and braking are far smoother).  I want to stay unplugged as its better then Toyota stock which is slow acceleration and hard and jerky braking which is truly their AEB at work.

**Additional context**
   Customer service advised it could be the OBD2 power unit or a plug.  I have a spare power module after its case opened and they sent me a second power module, so both were used.  I ran the 30hour time out power off using both power supplies this past week.  All cables are seated and are checked for firmness and fit.

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
    This manual booting allowed cars with unplugged  DSU's to avoid the car errors thrown when the car is started before Comma2.  Hence the errors,
"Pre-Collsion System Malfunction", 
"Headlight System Malfunction"
"Lane Departure Alert Malfunction"
These erros do not appear and all systems work if the Comma2 is ready before the car starts, and the reason for this bug report.

Attached a video, not professional showing the problem, and why allowing the Manual boot with the Comma2 power button is a necessary step before car starting for unplugged DSU users.

 Additional results 11-17-2020

It appearing that the programming has been changed. Latest test it shuts down after 10 hours but not 24 or 30.  Also was advised the tapping of the Comma2 screen when its in the screen saving mode was changed to a Comma2 sensor as it now opens by shutting the car door or  tap on the windshield, but more a vibration or movement sensor.  So it appears what ever controls the comma2 power options have been changed.
whoever checks these bugs please advise if this is correct.  Many of use might need the Power button to work rather then pulling the usb plug out then reinserting it.  This change is bad.

title: DM not recognizing chinky eyes at night
body:
**Describe the bug**

DM is not working as expected because it is not recognizing that my eyes are in fact open at night. 

This is most likely due to having chinky eyes, and the model is not trained to recognize them. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

I can verify this because the DM will warn that driver is not paying attention just a few seconds into activating OpenPilot, and if I strain to open my eyes wider, then the warning will go away but come right back without wide eyes.

**Expected behavior**

DM should be able to recognize whether eyes are open or closed, whether or not it is day or night.

**Device/Version information:**
 - Device: comma two
 - Dongle ID: 102110287766742152833
 - Route: 06d00785f52b907a
 - Timestamp: When in the route the bug occurs a few seconds after activating the system
 - Version: 0.7.9
 - Car make/model: Honda Civic Hatchback 2017

**Additional context**

This only occurs during the night. DM works just fine during the day. Not sure if it might be camera resolution or weak IR issue and if it can even be rectified. Just received the comma two and have experienced this right out of the box. Right now, I'm using a webcam cover to disable DM at night; not a great solution.

title: Bug: face detection stopped working during daylight conditions, works fine at night
body:
About a week ago I started getting frequent errors saying that no face was detected on my C2 when driving during the day. It seems to happen more frequently the brighter it is outside. Night drives work fine as always. It seems that the image preview during the day off the driver-facing camera is overexposed/washed out to the point where all detail in the face is obscured, showing only a bright silhouette. Night drives are unaffected and still work fine. Driving on a sunny day though now causes disengages and alarms every few seconds when using OP unless I pretty violently jerk the wheel immediately every time the error pops up. Light tap like on the stock Honda Sensing doesn't work. IR LED's are always on now in any lighting condition, though I admit I'm not sure if they're supposed to be always on or if previously they only came on at night.

Test drive with issue reproduced and driver-facing camera uploaded: Mon, Oct 26 @ 08:00 to 08:25

**How to reproduce or log data**

Drive during the day, the brighter the more often it occurs.

**Expected behavior**

Prior to this, C2 had the same view of driver. Seat position hasn't changed and C2/rearview mirror position is the same, but face tracking was working perfectly with a very high degree of accuracy.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma2
 - Dongle ID: bc014e9a661d4a5e
 - Route: bc014e9a661d4a5e|2020-10-26--08-00-09
 - Timestamp: Throughout the whole drive about twice a minute
 - Version: 0.7.11
 - Car make/model: 2017 Honda Civic EX sedan
**Additional context**

Since this issue started, I've updated from 7.10 to 7.11, and I did an OS update that I was prompted about. Also, my UI is extremely sluggish on the C2, with time from click to response being about 3-5 seconds. Not sure if it's related. No issues driving though. Attached image is during daylight showing IR emitters on and the overexposed image of driver face.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72579153/97227863-73d3b480-17ac-11eb-9a71-949e6e376f18.png)

title: Steer Unavailable Below xx mph alert on HKG stays on even above min steer speed
body:
**Describe the bug**
On a vehicle with min steer speed, the alert stays on for 4m/s above the min speed.

**How to reproduce or log data**
Enable OP at speed below min steer speed. Accelerate the vehicle above min steer speed. The steering is controlled above min steer speed however the alert stays on until the speed is above (min_steer_speed + 4m/s).

**Expected behavior**
offset_speed = 1m/s, when vehicle speed is above (min_steer_speed +1m/s)
offset_speed = 0m/s, when vehicle speed is below min_steer_speed
 - Alert should be displayed when vehicle speed is below (min_steer_speed + offset_speed)

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: [comma two]
 - Dongle ID: [6fe86b4e410e4c37]

title: Comma 2 crashes and becomes unresponsive with: echo -en "1" > /data/params/d/DisableUpdates
body:
**Describe the bug**
I can confirm after much troubleshooting that this causes the Comma 2 to crash and become unresponsive on vehicle power down
echo -en "1" > /data/params/d/DisableUpdates
I was told that is the way to prevent auto updates, but it does not work.
Comma 2 will shutdown and become unresponsive after the car ignition is turned off, resetting the comma 2 will allow it to sleep and wake upon next using the car, but it will crash again at vehicle power off and won't come back on unless it is reset.

**How to reproduce or log data**
SSH into the Comma 2 and enter the command: echo -en "1" > /data/params/d/DisableUpdates

**Expected behavior**
Comma 2 will wake up the next time the car is used and will not crash every time the car is turned off.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Comma 2
 - Dongle ID: 783f2ad3c4e2874b
 - Version: Stock OP version 0.7.9
 - Car make/model: Honda CR-V 2019

**Additional context**
If anyone knows how to actually keep the Comma 2 from auto updating please tell me! I hate having to use Dragonpilot
Thank you

title: HKG resume logic not working on Hyundai Genesis(2015-2016)
body:
**Describe the bug**

The new resume logic in Master-Ci for HKG doesn't work on the Hyundai Genesis(2015-2016), This can be an issue with other older HKG cars. The resume logic is triggered when the standstill flag from SCC is set. This often allows the SCC to accept once or twice during a stop but often misses when the lead starts to move. 

**How to reproduce or log data**

ACC activated behind a stopped target vehicle to start the resume logic 

**Expected behavior**

Resume and continue moving when the lead starts to move.

title: Snapshot request when onroad causes openpilot to go offroad
body:
**Describe the bug**

Requesting a snapshot while on onroad causes openpilot to go temporarily offroad. I see the offroad snapshot alert and then eventually dash errors (a bit of delay on Honda Bosch). Onroad does come back after the snapshot sequence finishes.

Note: It looks like the process check in snapshot.py is returning an empty array/list when onroad. Is something killing camerad?

**How to reproduce or log data**

1. Go onroad.
2. Request a snapshot via the API.
3. Device will go offroad and show the snapshot alert. CAN sending appears to stop during the sequence.
4. The snapshots intermittently make it back through via the API. Other times, they don't.

**Expected behavior**

Nothing. Return None and don't pull snapshots when onroad.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: comma two

title: SNPE Race condition between modeld and dmonitoringmodeld
body:
Presumably a race condition in SNPE causes higher dmonitoringmodeld cpu usage and lags in model running. In testing this happens about 1/120 times. When going through user data we notice increased model lags in about 1/1200 drives.

https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/pull/2216 improved the situation, but the problem is not completely gone.

title: [Nissan Leaf] Disengages when lead car slows below 20mph
body:
To replicate:

1. Have openpilot activated for steering, with Nissan stock system doing longitudinal control.
2. Have lead car indicated on HUD with set speed faster than lead car speed.
3. Lead car brakes for a complete stop.

At this point, the Nissan system starts braking, but at about 20mph, 9/10 times adaptive cruise control disengages, openpilot disengages, and the HUD shows a "seatbelt warning" saying that the system can't be engaged if the seat belt is not connected (I can't remember the exact message text).

It is quite jarring for all adaptive cruise control to suddenly disengage mid-braking :/ 

With the stock Nissan adaptive cruise control, this (obviously) does not happen.

title: Fix frequent modeld lags
Hyundai SCC automatic resume is unreliable
body:
**Describe the bug**

Somewhere in the range of 1% to 10% of the time the car will not accept the resume command from openpilot for 5+ seconds

**How to reproduce or log data**

Sit behind a parked car, engage, and let openpilot send the resume command repeatedly when the car goes into the state where it says press pedal or accel button to resume.

**Expected behavior**

The car always accepts the resume command from openpilot within a second and goes back into the state where it is prepared to accelerate immediately when the lead vehicle pulls away.

**Device/Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Route: You should be able to easily reproduce this issue, if not I can record and provide a route
 - Timestamp: n/a
 - Version: 01111b3f28c748769db8f27646d9086f00a417ef
 - Car make/model: 2020 Hyundai Palisade

**Additional context**

https://github.com/commaai/openpilot/blob/e8c8e9dab25c81fbeefa4fa05bf38166f9abe203/selfdrive/car/hyundai/carcontroller.py#L79-L80

Most of the time the car will accept the very first resume command openpilot sends, but some percentage of the time it takes way too long and you have to manually resume.

What I have tried:
- making the parity bit always correct, and always incorrect and neither seemed to change the reliability (so it seems like the parity bit doesn't matter)
- making the counter always the last counter + 1, sending 15 messages all at once incrementing the counter for each message (so it wraps around back to the next value the car would send) and always sending the counter - 1 which should always be incorrect and nothing seemed to change the reliability (so it seems like the counter doesn't matter)
- increasing the frequency all the way up to 100 Hz, which causes the car to fault and engage the parking break sometimes, and it seems like the higher you increase the frequency the less reliable it becomes

The vehicle sends the button state at 50 Hz so perhaps sometimes the next message from the vehicle will come in very close after openpilot sent a message, overriding what openpilot sent?

I would guess this is an issue for the Sonata and Palisade since they use the same radar and this is related to SCC, and perhaps other vehicles, too.
